name: Riverbanks Zoo & Garden
reviews: The animals are an amazing sight to see. There was an area were you can pet goats, the goats were peaceful creatures. A rhinoceros area is coming in summer, 2020. The most fun I had was called the ropes. The ropes got your adrenaline going. Trust me you will not want to get off of it. I totally recommend  going to Riverbanks Zoo & Garden.

I grew up with a Riverbanks Zoo pennant on my wall most of my young life.  My parents brought me there and I totally enjoyed it.  Few years back we were in the area visiting family and we saw they were doing Boo at the Zoo.  We kind of plan for it on our way down bringing our costumes.  We had a great time.  The park was all decorated for Halloween.  The exhibits were too.  It is a great zoo!  Lots to see and do, barely can do all in 1 day.  Take your time, check out their schedule and try to attend some of the cooler things.  You can't go wrong here!

Although it is most recommendable to come in the spring, especially when you're heavy on loving different array of flowers. The Riverbank Zoo & Garden sure had its perks through sightseeing and attractions. I especially loved how all of your coworkers and trainers there are so passionate in their workings with each animals that were featured there! It was sweet as it was exciting!

Loved every minute of our visit. Animals are happy and in clean environments. Staff are friendly and very informative. The Botanical Garden is beautiful. Even in February. Definitely a great place to visit.

The place was awesome. They have the most incredible reptile exhibit. Husband and I loved it more than the tots. The place is super clean as well as the I called animal housing was really clean. I'd recommend it to everyone

name: South Carolina Military Museum
address: 1 National Guard Rd, Columbia, SC 29201, USA
reviews: I went here to have a German bayonet looked at and while there I took a quick stroll around.  Mr. Freeman was very helpful and told me a few things about the bayonet I brought in.  He was very helpful and I appreciate the research he did on my behalf. This is a great military museum hidden behind the state armory. I will definitely be back in to take a longer stroll through all the exhibits!
Nice museum that honors our wonderful military history. Very informative. They could have better signage along the main road to attract more visitors.
Great museum! This was a quick stop with four boys on the way to TN... boys were ages 2 - 12 all liked getting to see the pieces this museum has including the mechanized display they have

Amazing displays from revolutionary wars to the Iraq war including information on 9/11. Uniforms from different eras. Mostly Army and some Air Force. Military equipment ranging from helicopters to tanks! Spoke with a retired Army volunteer who made models of Amy equipment from tanks to transport equipment. Very impressed of what I saw definitely ranks high amongst all the large museums.
Great history. A must see for military buffs. Staff is wonderful.

name: South Carolina State Museum
reviews: First time in this museum, so much to learn from here 🙌🏼  good service, good attention, professional staff, everything is clean, very colorful. You’ll find out a lot about South Carolina History, the time transition from the past to present, about the colonial government, you’ll see many maps. This museum it’s about science, society, culture, etc. This museum is amazing place for the kids to see and ask questions, the have the chance and the opportunity to ask and to be curious, we all can learn so much, I love this place and I recommend to come visit with the whole family I’ll come again for sure, because you can see about the revolution and evolution, you can see old routes that’s good for google map and on some on my pictures check it. In this museum museum you’ll see cool things like old transportation, you can find few theaters, it’s a big museum. It’s a café place Check all my pictures, let me know what you think, hit like to all of them 👍🏼

We came for the NASA exhibit, but we're really surprised at how great the other exhibits were. We saw two shows, one at the 4D theater and one in the planetarium. Both were great and the kids loved them.

The museum features four stories of various themed exhibits, including the NASA and Apollo exhibit, fossils and dinosaurs, and South Carolina history. There was also a Sherlock Holmes feature, but we did not explore that because our children didn't seem interested. I was surprised at the amount of things to explore and we spent a good amount of the day here, which is more than I can say for the EdVenture museum across the parking lot.

So this was my first time at this museum ever. I truly enjoyed myself and the exhibits. I got to see one of the planetarium shows as well and that was definitely fun to do. We were there for 2 or 3 hours and still didn't see everything. I look forward to the next time we visit though.

Very clean and organized. I loved that they had several elevators for our stroller and for handicapped folks. The staff was very friendly and the exhibits were fascinating. The thing I liked most was there was a family room on the bottom floor that was available for nursing moms.

Saw 4D Sherlock Holmes cartoon movie. 3D and additional 4D effects were GREAT. 
Being a Member has many Benefits. Plenty of parking.  Fully HANDICAPPED ACCESSIBLE, elevators make it very easy to navigate the 4 floors.

name: Riverbanks Botanical Garden
address: 1300 Botanical Pkwy, West Columbia, SC 29169, USA
reviews: Love every part of this place!  A true gem in the Midlands of South Carolina.  The gardens are as pretty to walk through in winter as they are in the spring.  Super clean.  Friendly staff.  Animals are active earlier in the day...try to arrive as soon as they open due to that reason.

Always love visiting the zoo! Just a nice stroll through the gardens and down to see the animals!
Love making memories with the family at Riverbanks!  Weather was PERFECT! The animals were out playing with each other, and we were able to get some great pictures!

We always have a great time at the zoo and botanical gardens! There's a lot more for kids to do and see at the gardens since our last trip about 3 years ago. Our family really enjoyed visiting this weekend!

The gardens are somewhat small in comparison to some of the other attractions on the property. The fact that they are connected to Riverbanks Zoo (by tram or short walk) is a huge plus. Doing both in a single visit is doable, but makes for a long day. Definitely a good way for the kids to burn some energy.
Fantastic layout. I love to see all of the well kept plants, flowers and trees. We enjoy stopping in whatever we can.

name: Columbia Canal and Riverfront Park
reviews: A wonderful experience!  Obvious what the City is doing with tax payers money.  They have come a long way over the years.  A variety of seating, picnic tables, playground areas.  It's an athlete's Oasis with the paved winding trail.  I will definitely visit more often!

This is one of the things we love about Columbia and it's getting better. Expansions are going to be stellar and help Cola stand out. Rushing waters can be viewed along the way, but now there are even chairs and hammocks to relax in. A great way to spend a couple hours and get some exercise too.

More for dogs rather then people... the only bathroom is at the front of the trail. Im pregnant and pee a lot so I couldn't get very far down the trail without having to turn around. Please make other facilities available. Saw a lot of doggy bag stations... they are not the only ones who have to go!

Gorgeous free river walk! There are trails along the river with tables on overlooks, Spanish moss hanging from the trees, and a really nice area with hammocks and Adirondack chairs.  What a great way to spend the afternoon close to the downtown area.

Riverfront Park was great when it opened in 1986, but unfortunately city of Columbia parks and rec is unable to manage our park system properly.  The roads are crumbling, the signs are falling down, parts are closed off.  It's just a mess.  That said if you want to get out and take a run its a nice place to go as long as you get there before it gets crowded.

name: EdVenture Children's Museum
reviews: This place is an incredible gem in Columbia. Possibly the best children's museum I've ever visited. My four kids were all engaged and busy for the whole 6 hours we were there, and they could happily have stayed for hours more. If you have kids, this is a must-see in Columbia. If you live here, it's one hundred percent worth the membership!

Two year old son had a blast.  He found a friend to play with and the experience was wonderful.   As a pilot and former volunteer fire fighter, the exhibits were great.  Only problem was that the thrust levers on the 757 didn't advance for takeoff.

A great day adventure with many different educational adventures. Food court had great food at reasonable prices, all staff was very friendly and there seemed like so much to do. Highly recommend if you have children and have never been!

Our three year old really enjoyed it, but our eight year old was bored. There really isn't enough here to engage an older kid. We were disappointed that despite the large outward appearance of the building, there really wasn't much to keep our kids occupied for an extended time. I had expected to spend half a day here, but we struggled to stay more than an hour without revisiting areas.

I don't really agree with the pricing, either. We paid for two adults and two kids, but after our experience, I wondered what exactly it is the adults are expected to enjoy? It's not like a science museum where people of all ages are encouraged to interact with the exhibits. There's nothing for a parent to do, other than follow the kids around. Certainly, most of the crawling areas can barely accommodate a grown man like myself. Overall, I think the experience was overpriced.

As a retired Veteran, I enjoy the opportunity to spend more quality time with my family after 20 years of service. Our children asked to go to the Children's Museum, so my wife Tamara Pierre and I took our family (ages 5, 8 and 10) to EdVenture Children’s Museum and we all had an amazing time. My children's favorite activity is the Publix grocery store. They REALLY do enjoy shopping! (I wonder where they get that from!!! 😏)

I especially enjoyed playing hockey and interacting with all the children. At first it was just a couple of us playing, and before I knew it... there were 6 kids (of all ages) vs. ME!!! 😎 Don't worry folks... I got this!!

My 5 year old Elite Jr. (in the black jacket) is a very timid and socially awkward child. This was his first time playing such an aggressive sport with so many bigger kids. All the kids were very kind and helpful allowing him to take shots too.

After organizing a short game right before closing, the kids won 4 to 1. 😟

All of the parents of the other children thanked me for organizing the game and playing with the kids. One mother even pulled me aside and asked me to apply for a job to work as an Educator at the museum. She was so impressed by how I engaged with the children, she said, "I'd hire you in a minute!"

I applied for the position today! Wish me luck!

name: The Final Door Escape Room Columbia
address: 930 Knox Abbott Dr, Cayce, SC 29033, USA
reviews: This was a great experience!  This particular one was kid friendly.  It brought much excitement.

Visited this establishment with my whole family. Our group consisted of my wife, my three daughters (ages 13,11, and 8), and myself. We chose to do the Down the Rabbit hole room. We were able to just barely escape with mere minutes remaining with a little bit of help from the overseer. The overseer did help more than I would have liked but clearly we needed every bit of help to finish on time. For the room itself it was fantastically themed and the puzzles had a lot of variety to theme. I will definitely be returning to try the other rooms!
Mitsy was the best! She scared us and made it great! This was our 3rd escape room with them. All our experiences were great! We beat 2 rooms and lost 1 room. This experience is worth the money!

We did Down the Rabbit Hole room and it was so clever!  We absolutely loved it. We've done escape rooms in other states and this place was one of our favorites.  Noah, The Mad Hatter, was hilarious. He was entertaining in his part and made the whole experience that much better.

We had a ton of fun in The Sacrifice tonight.  The atmosphere at The Final Door was amazing, out Game Master (Mitchell) was wonderful, and the room was the perfect mix of fun and challenging. As soon as you walk in the building, you feel like you've stepped into a different world, and I can't wait to try out the other rooms.

name: Columbia Museum of Art
reviews: I had higher hopes of the Tribe exhibit, seeing as there were several areas dedicated to horror films, but I digress. The collector's exhibits in the  upstairs area was the hidden gem, I was able to explore and learn so much. Beautiful for a different type of day date, great conversation starters. Make it your own
Gorgeous inside and out.  First Thursdays are free to locals. The terrific gift shop is free to browse all the time!  Great for locally made art or beautiful mass produced.  All make great gifts.

If you love art then you will love this place. I would recommend looking up their special events and going then since they have some fun and interesting events and you still get to experience the art on display.  A recent fun one I went to was the Wizard of Oz pop up.

Just saw the last day of the van Gogh- themed exhibition. Well done, I think. Very fine rotation of their permanent pieces. Smaller, accessible venue. Superb location with many amenities in immediate walking distance. A credit to the rejuvenation of Columbia's downtown.

Wonderful Art museum. It's a good size museum, not too big and over whelming and yet not not too small. I was able to see the Van Gogh exhibit and really enjoyed it.  I would recommend looking at their website and seeing what exhibit is in town so that you can pick something that you are interested in seeing and skipping what you're not interested in. 
The stationary exhibits are also very lovely.

name: Soda City Market
reviews:
It's a nice place to go in the weekends but the actual farmers market is not always great. 
It's much better in the summertime. A lot of times there's more food trucks than people selling there products, fruits and veggies. 
Still a fun place to walk around and eat on Saturdays.

Best place ever. So much fun! Great food, great vendors, great events! Soda City is an awesome organization that does more than put on an awesome market every single Saturday! The market, alone, is amazing though! If you don’t have anything to do, you can always count on the Soda City market to be in full swing every Saturday! Such a great community building event for Columbia!

I would leave my wallet at home unless you have more money than you know what to do with, but wow so so much fun. so much fu!lfood crafts nice people dogs everywhere music every Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. go you'll be glad you did. By the way, I did not follow my on advice. May who needs electricity anyway I have a hand carved wooden bowl it's beautiful

Wow, just wow! The most awesome food!!! If you can be patient and wait in a few lines, man. . . eat your heart out! It will take you a few weeks, a few months even (if you aren't a pig like me lol) to get through all the food truck/vendors but it is SO worth it!! There is a fresh fruit and vegetable market, which is really cool. There are also some regular vendors selling products. One we really liked was Wag More Collars ❤🐾 The staff were friendly and amazing and the collars and bows were beyond beautiful! I also love that the Soda City Market is animal friendly! My pup gets to socialize with people of all ages and other pups. It's overall a great experience. One that makes for an enjoyable Saturday in Columbia.

Worth checking out on the weekends if you are nearby. Would not drivefor miles to come but was overall a great experience. The breads bakery items I was impressed at the worldly selection of food products. Small farmers market as well.

name: Frankie's Fun Park
reviews: This place is so cool not only for children but adults too. The laser tag was so awesome, it was the first time I had played. It was just me and my family who played and my sisters score didn't add up, almost like it wasn't turned on. So the employee let all of us play again. Great customer service. It started raining when we went to play mini golf, so they gave us a refund of our money. I've been back a few times. Expect to spend quite a bit of money when you come tho. My niece and nephew loved the child playground that they have inside. It felt safe because there was only one entrance to it.

I haven't been here in years and how I like the upgrade of games and adventures. It was clean down to the bathrooms and Eating area. My daughter really enjoyed the Go Carts and Drop tower and I enjoyed the Batting cages. We'll be back

We went on a Thursday and I loved it. It wasn't packed. I enjoyed not having to wait for lines of people to play games. 
During the summer when everything is open, drift park, water bumper cars, the go cart track,  drop zone and the mini golf it's so fun!!! It's also busy. Not like the other well known franchise but busy. The drop zone is perfect for little ones. The drift track was my favorite! We did that a number of times. The line for the race track was long. We didnt have a chance to do that but it will be something I'll do when we go back.
My son and his friend had a great time for his birthday here yesterday.  I mean it is pretty pricey,  but they had fun! It was their first time there....I would say it was a hit.

Had a blast! We went in October around 830pm. Boys loved the go kart race tracks. We got soaked on the bumper boats and never stopped laughing.  The employees were awesome and were very energetic. I liked that they answered all my sons questions with a smile. We did the fun maze and that was a blast. The arcade has some fun games and they all were working! It was clean. Bathrooms were clean.  My soft pretzel was delicious.  Definitely going again!

name: West Columbia Riverwalk Park and Amphitheater
reviews: A great place to go for a walk and view the river. The area is well kept and maintained. There are times especially after a long rain that the area will flood. Seeing the river flowing was a really neat experience, I've gone a couple times already and would recommend it for anyone who wants to take a nice hike with a wonderful view.

Beautiful. I come here with my baby and dogs. I always feel safe and there are officers that ride through the park very often. So stunning. Great for a nice walk or run. Or to just grab some food and sit!

Great for morning/evening walks. Try both the trails. It's Pet friendly. Parking spots are limited, lucky if you find a spot. Parking is free though 😊. You can carry some quick bites and have it there are a few picnic tables/ some stairs kinda thing. We did spot some snakes in the water .. wouldn't suggest going bare but good to go on floaters esp during summer.

Love this place! It's a wonderful place to walk or run! Today however it's completely underwater. It's February 8, 2020 and we've gotten a lot of rain in a very little time. This is worse flooding then the 2015 flood.

Limited parking is the only trouble. This is a lovely place to take a walk or run. Kids love to play at the riverbank. Small area sometimes features live music and river float/kayak rentals during certain months. Pet friendly. Bikes and skating are allowed. Plenty of grass space and pretty views for a picnic!

name: Robert Mills House and Gardens
reviews:
This handsome, historic house and museum at 1616 Blanding Street in Columbia, South Carolina was built in 1823,  preserved by the Historic Columbia Foundation and designated a National Historic Landmark in 1974. 

It was designed by South Carolina native architect Robert Mills, notable for not just one but two Washington monuments.

Tours are offered regularly, providing insight into the history of the  building and grounds reflecting the symmetrical Early Republic, Federalist architectural style. 

The backyard formal garden is a beautiful highlight of the visit, mirroring the graceful elegance of the antebellum era.

One of the highlights of visiting Columbia South Carolina. The house has a rich history involving Robert Mills, the architect of the house and most famous for designing the Washington monument. The guide was very informative and always asked if we had questions. Great Costomer service all around. The price for a guided tour is $10 a person and well worth it.
Beautiful! Very nice tour guide as well. Very friendly and welcoming. Good people,  beautiful place.
Lovely grounds and buildings, beautiful interior. Our guide was very knowledgeable and charming.

Fascinating! Robert Mills was a famous architect. He built this home though no one ever lived in it. Mills designed the Washington Monument. This house gives you a feel of life in the south in the early 1800's.

name: South Carolina Confederate Relic Room and Military Museum
reviews: Very nice museum. My kids enjoyed it. Best part of it is that it was only 1$ for entrance per person. So many things to look at, will definitely be going back soon to finish looking at everything this museum has to offer!
Went for the Sherlock Holmes tour. So much fun, from 8years old to 61years . We all found something fun
An excellent opportunity to view the best collection of War Between the States artifacts in world.

Absolute must for a Historian!! Great exhibit, easy to get to, took awhile to read and navigate exhibit. Did not bother me at all!! Many photos, flags and testimonials from Civil War veterans!! You will not be disappointed

This was a fun museum and my fiance and I really enjoyed checking out all the exhibits. The museum itself is comprised of 4 separate stories, each story containing 3-5 different exhibits. There are also there different shows you can attend if you get the "Master Explorer Ticket" which cost approximately $12 per adult including a 4D show, a planetarium show, and an exhibit show. It was a fun day and we really enjoyed our experience. The ONLY reason this is getting 3 stars is due to my experiences with museum trips in cities such as San Diego, Washington D.C., and Norfolk which are vastly larger as would be expected.

name: Harbison State Forest
address: 5600 Broad River Rd, Columbia, SC 29212, USA
reviews: This park has the best trails around for any activity. I go here to run and bike the trails. There's only so much that the Midlands have to offer in terms of terrain, so after that is taken into consideration this is a five star place to be. For bikes the biggest challenge in the area can be to find areas with decent trails and no deep sand. Harbison has basically no sandy problem areas and the riding is flowing and fast. As a trail runner I enjoy running different routes and not covering the same trails more than once. There's tons of miles to run on here and the other day I ran a half marathon here in my training. I thoroughly enjoyed the scenery and we'll maintained trails.
I absolutely love this trail system. Always have some of my most memorable runs here.
Always enjoyed walking the trails with the buddies back in the day! Went there recently and still as beautiful and fun to walk as back then! Highly recommend!

It's a great forest. What more is there to say? It's good that with such a short drive you can be in the woods enjoying nature.  The drawback is that you can still hear alot of the sounds of the city life but I'll take that for some easy access hiking. The forest is pretty flat over all. There's plenty of trails to choose from to get a nice quick hike in or to spend the day on.

Every time I come through Columbia, I make it a point to mountain bike at Harbison State Forest. The trails are well maintained and they seem to drain quickly after a rain (though, you may want to check with a LBS instead of taking my word on that). They have a bike wash station with a couple of brushes to help keep the boys of the park in the park instead of going home with you. There is also a pair of dog bowls with water for your furry friend. Trail dogs are welcome do long as you keep them leashed. Unfortunately, there is no bathroom at the trail head. If you have to go, you'll need to head down the trail to one of the pit toilets. 

There is parking, but I've found that it can get crowded on the weekends.

Cost to play is $5/day or $25/year. Will worth it!

name: Waterfall Junction
address: Mohawk Dr, West Columbia, SC 29169, USA
reviews: Beautiful area! In the garden area my eyes were wondering everywhere with all the beautiful flowers and designs all around. My kids absolutely LOVED the play area in the back. Had a dinosaur fossil digging area, little clubhouses, big tree house to walk in, waterpark area, grassy area for them to run around, cool little tunnels, But that's just the stuff that I remember! I think I could come in the summer and the family would probably just stay in the Waterfall Junction area the whole time! Oh and I like the little hike you can take (optional) in order to make it to this part of the Zoo.

Lots to do but kids like to walk fast and still fall on the slick cement. They really need to change the flooring. We stayed with our kids the whole time but kept helping other kids up.
Kids were falling everywhere and busting heads and faces. 
Like that alcohol is available but way over priced and food is zoo food so again pricey for old stail chips.
Great place for a family staycation. The Zoo has more than enough to keep your animal lovers entranced, and the splash pad provides a cool respite from the heat

Such a nice, aesthetically-pleasing area for families to enjoy and cool off during a visit to the zoo & gardens. We were very impressed by the features and plan to visit many more times. There is a smaller area for young children, games on the lawn, seating, refreshments & snacks, etc....all in one spot! We loved Waterfall Junction!
Absolutely gorgeous and fun place for families. Makes for great photo ops! 📸

name: Governor's Mansion
reviews: I have been to the grounds of the Governor's Mansion many times. It is always well maintained.  During every season there is some natural wonder to see. It is always beautiful.
Such an awesome place and beautiful grounds
a beautiful place - excellent for photography and special events. my stepbrother and his (now) wife got married here a few months ago - and I was amazed by the beauty and charm of the place!
I did not expect to find Lace House Gardens downtown. It is something different and night if you want to walk and clear your mind.
Great place for an event, wedding and it was also nice to meet the Gov. Too!

name: World's Largest Fire Hydrant
reviews:
Cool piece of street art and who does not love one of these 'worlds largest' items!

It's located at the side of the road and the whole of this area felt a bit sketchy to be honest.

Parking is limited nearby and there is not much in this area apart from the Hydrant itself. It seems years ago there was a water feature stroke element but this is now broken on the sculpture.

Also check out the mural nearby.

This is free public art installation by South Carolinian artist "Blue Sky".

This would be a fun little stop if you have little kids is it promotes some wonder and fun conversations. 

According to Atlas obscura it weighs 675,000 pounds and was built to withstand a hurricane even though it was designed to look as though it had been hit by a giant car. 

Paid parking is available in the "Busted Plug Plaza" and on the street in front of it. Another of blue skies
"Tunnelvision" is nearby as well.

👩‍🚒 FREE PUBLIC ART. 👩‍🚒 

See you on the road,
📸 🙋‍♂️@gabrielcraft.me

This is the first time I have been at a "world's largest" thing. It would be very nice if they gave it a better surround-not just traffic walls and chain link fence. The mural in the same lot is incredible as well.
This was a neat sculpture, but the location was pretty odd and there was quite a bit of construction around it's perimeter. Maybe that's part of the art...not sure.

Just a random fire hydrant sculpture in the middle of downtown. Good photo opportunity, but nothing more. Also, it was hard to find parking and it’s surrounded my business. There are lots of cool murals around.

name: Riverfront Park
reviews:
Small but with a nice view. Not too much to say, sometimes the pictures does equal thousands of words. 
The bridge amazed me because it has some details you don't usually see on bridges. So from underneath you can see the sunset and its light on the bridge that creates a nice scenery. A nice walk a little bit out of downtown, not far at all, yet it reveals a more calm and natural side of the city.

It is close to the edventure museum for kids, so it is good for a family walk.

A quiet place off Gist Street. Parking room for maybe a dozen vehicles, including handicapped parking. 
Just a little bit down are a set of large rocks under trees that provide nice shade for a peaceful break from the city. Follow the path down a little and there's an overlook, near the bridge.
Nice place to visit lots of history. Dont visit when really hot though is my advice.
Had a nice time out today at the river front near meeting street! Will definitely go back when it gets warmer to enjoy the sun and the sound of the river.
Excellent access to a beautiful river.  If you visit, enjoy the area.  Please, remember "if you pack it in, pack it out".  Let's keep our natural resources clean and litter free for all to enjoy.

name: Hampton-Preston Mansion and Gardens
reviews:
Lovely garden 
Landscaping is excellent 
The shade trees, makes you want to camp out there
Excellent docent information complements what you'll see in the mansion.  Gardens are improving with funding to restore their glory.

This is a beautiful and well-maintained property. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable on the history of the property and the stories of the people who lived there. She was very passionate about the subject and pleasantly engaging with the tour group. Highly recommend for an educating and entertaining view of Columbia history
Beautiful Garden convenient to downtown.
Went for the Holiday tour. Very fast and disorganized.

name: Palmetto Falls Water Park
reviews: Enjoyed it. Please do not wear cotton. I got to sunbathe too😊

Actually didn't go to waterpark as it is closed. We went to the playground. My grandkids love it there. And they have it decorated beautifully for Christmas. Everyone should visit. Especially at night to see the lights. Great!

So this is a cute little water park close to home. My husband is a disabled vet so I am unsure about civilians with no military affiliations being allowed on. The process was simple the life guards are everywhere watching after the kids. And there is a little something for all ages. This is not by any means a large park but def fun. No outside food or beverages band if you have a cwp you still cannot being firearms on base. All looks to be fairly clean. Def a nice time to spend with family

While the kids enjoyed this my concern would be how hot the wood was even with mats over top it was scaulding to walk on and when you tried to hurry they blew the whistle at you for running. 
I did appreciate how the lifeguards actually did their job and kept things running smoothly. But I also think they were a little too aggressive in some instances.

My kiddos and I love it! Return several times! Small but fun, lifeguards always on point! The price for entry is low, and food is inexpensive but good! I would also like to share today's experience. Shout out to management! As I was leaving a family was trying to come in with a dachshund but couldn't bring it in. So the older man and little girl took it back to the car and left it! Then the family tried buy tickets to cool off from the 96 degree day! The park DENIED them entry because they didn't want the dog left in car! 👏🐶

name: Sesquicentennial State Park
address: 9564 Two Notch Rd, Columbia, SC 29223, USA
reviews: The park itself was beautiful.  Two of the trails are super kid friendly. The waterfall was amazing for the kids. Plenty of places for picnics. We got to feed the geese which made their day. Definitely will go again.
Nice little area. Had a great time camping with family. Nice, convenient place to stay while down for my sons basic training graduation.
Lots to do for families or outdoor enthusiast. Biking, hiking, paddle boats, camping, playgrounds, dog park to name a few. I love this place.

Great place to relax in a kayak and hike some trails. It's not free to get in, you need to pay per vehicle, about 10$ or 100$ for the year. Parking outside the park and walking in, is not a great option.

The trails alone are worth the visit but the campground is equally fantastic!  Everyone is so friendly too.
I got 20 miles on the trail system here and never got bored.

name: Finlay Park
reviews: It's not what it once was. When I was a child, it was a favorite. It's since definitely gone downhill. The playground is nice but they need to get the fountain back up and running...clean the water. I also don't feel safe there anymore. I miss the days when it had families, bike riders, people playing frisbee. Those were the days.

A beautiful oasis of nature in the middle of Columbia. It has a nice pond and fountain with walking paths and a playground. The playground is great for able bodied children but not for those with special needs. The park hosts numerous events and concerts throughout the year. Parking is limited and you could end up walking a couple blocks to get here.

Went down to take blankets and bookbags to the homeless. It was awesome and they really appreciated the items. Will be going back to take more items and food. It was good for my daughters to see that there are people that live like that.

Love visiting. Park is usually clean and the view of downtown is breathe taking. I spent a lot of lunch breaks here when I lived in the area. There can be a lot of homeless people there but they don't usually bother you. Great place to workout and talk a walk. Nice for picnicking and hosting events.

2 stars for layout and the potential view
No stars because there is sooo many homeless. I was approached by 3 guys asking to use my phone to find out where his brother is. Um no, not going to happen. There was packs of homeless people all over. 
There is no fountain / waterfall, there is trash everywhere needs TLC on paths and steps (dangerous) 
You don't see homeless ones in my pictures because I tried to hide the Debbie downer points.

name: Granby Park
reviews: Great place to go and take the dogs for a nice walk. Beautiful place.
Great walk to beat the heat plenty of places to stop and sit and take pictures
Very cool walking trail near the river but still in the heart of the city.
Easy trails; nice shade trees, lots of benches & fantastic bird song. Clean rest room in cute building adjacent to parking lot.  Highly recommend!

We went on a rainy, muddy day-- I loved it! We slipped and slid through some of the trails and had a ball. Definitely peaceful and a great place to meditate- especially near the waterfall there. We went to magnet fish- no luck but a great experience with nature in the city. I would visit again on a dryer day just to tackle some of the trails that were blocked by water and mud.

name: Saluda Shoals Park
address: 5605 Bush River Rd, Columbia, SC 29212, USA
reviews:
I love this place. Membership costs are reasonable, day passes are available, and there are lots of things to see and do here. Fishing, running, walking, hiking, biking, bird watching, canoeing, a dog park, playgrounds, a splash pad, an athletic complex; outdoor activities are pretty well covered. Then of course they have the locally famous holiday lights, a jazz music series, and they host a variety of events.

No place is perfect, but I have found that the administration is very conscientious about addressing issues that are brought to their attention. The staff seem invested in keeping the park in good shape. Visitors to the park are a fairly diverse bunch, and most of the folks that I've met who are first timers plan on returning.

I brought my kids here to do their homework and play when they were little. My wife and I renewed our vows here. I bring my dogs here daily. It is a local treasure, in my opinion.

A terrific way to spend the day in this hidden gem. Bring your own bikes or rent some, you can rent or bring your own tubes and kayaks to go down the river. They have pick up service for rental patrons. A enviromental center with play area for kids. As well as tons of paved and non paved trails for walking and bike riding. They also have a splash pad and covered play area and a handicap accessible nice new play ground and sports fields and tennis courts.

We love the dog park here!  All kinds of pups show up and they have all been respectful to our new, one year old Lab.  It's about 3.5 acres, 2/3 grass and 1/3 woods. Theres a fire hydrant water fountain, three dog pools with drains and a hose so you can change the water.
Great smaller venue. Attended South Carolina Paracon and got to meet some amazing paranormal celebrities. Not too big and plenty of room for speakers, vendors, fans, and therapy dogs!
This is one of my favorite parks in the northwest.  Lots of trails to walk around, a small area for tubing or kayaking, a huge dog park, and an amazing all inclusive playground.

name: Irmo Community Park
reviews: Such a beautiful park! Great new playground, walking or riding trail, and lots of pokestops and gyms for playing pokemon Go
A great Park. Point Blank. 😃

Nice wooded area with plenty of space for the children to play. There is a small stage field bands to play. The jungle gym area for the children was colorful. The only thing that I noticed missing was trash cans. They had a couple but not near enough for my liking. There is also a pavilion for people to rest under.
There is a lot of pokestops so I love them and there's raids
Excellent place for grandchildren to play and get rid of that excess energy!

name: Mann-Simons Site
reviews: We did a tour, and walk through this place. The staff tells you about the history of the house and of Columbia. It was a great place to visit.
Fun and educational look into the history of Columbia, SC.  The house is well maintained, and some of the artifacts on display are from local excavations.
Jubilee Festival was amazing. Look forward to this event every year. Very well planned.
Remarkable history!
Great place to visit. History in Columbia.

name: IrmoTown Park
reviews: My wife and I love this park. We love it so much, we actually chose it to be the place where we were married. This park is focused on nature and the beauty found within that nature. The park is serene which makes it a great place to think and relax. There are no pieces of playground equipment at this park. Again, this park is focused on the beauty of nature.
Such a lovely respite in the middle of a busy area! Well kept and lit well at night. Benches, gazebo, water feature with fish, and public bathrooms as well.
A relaxing place to stroll and/or Pokemon hunt.  Beautifully landscaped and well laid out. A small gem in the Irmo community.
Came here for some outdoor family photos. What a great location!

What a nice little park! My family stopped here for a picnic lunch on our way from Kentucky to the coast, and were very happy to find this place! It's a lovely green space with a pond, picnic tables, a large gazebo, and public restrooms.

name: Elmwood/Roy Lynch Park
reviews: Great little park in downtown Columbia! It's kind of small but very kid friendly. Their climbing structures are interesting,newish and in good condition.they have a monorail type swing  like I have never seen before and had a hard time getting my 7yo granddaughter to give it up! Only downside is no bathrooms but considering the area I can understand.

Nice. We loved it. I unvoluntarily sunbathed though becuse the splash pad part of the park isn't really shady but i loved the water it was nice. Nephew wished water was continuous but he got use to it. He loved the playground area. It was shady to me, new and clean and the water is user operated!
Nice Peace and Quiet with Alot of Surveillance Cameras around the park😎😎
Awesome park with great facilities, slides, fountains, swings, channel line and more. Recommended totally for kids of all ages and family groups.

Cute little park near downtown Columbia. Plenty of shade. One entrance to park. Play areas for smaller and bigger kids, swings, and a cool little zipline. Small splash pad perfect for cooling off. Only downfall, no restrooms.

name: McKissick Museum
reviews: LOVE LOVE the McKissick Museum!!
A beautifully designed piece of architecture.
Welcome to Gboard clipboard, any text you copy will be saved here.Touch and hold a clip to pin it. Unpinned clips will be deleted after 1 hour.
So McKissick is a museum as well as an office location AND the USC welcome center.   Stick to the museum part and you'll be fine.
Nice collections of memorabilia !

name: Memorial Park
reviews: The park could use better grooming techniques and the homeless that sleep there.  I found a used condom by an isolated statue I had to pull my dog away from trying to eat.  That was disgusting. Please help to do your part and "clean" up the park. Our Veterans deserve better.
It's great just needs a restroom
It needs some cleaning but other than that it was beautiful!
Great feelings to standing beside a Veteran and that loving dog 🐕

Very nice memorials in this park. A little hard to find but worth seeing. Really sad though that several homeless men were sleeping on or near several statues and someone actually defecated behind one. Unacceptable!

name: Owens Field Skate Park
address: 1351 Jim Hamilton Blvd, Columbia, SC 29205, USA
reviews: Great little skatepark. Three nice bowls, one of which has real pool coping and tile. The concrete is still in good shape on everything and it was free of garbage.

What a great place, we drive from Waxhaw NC for our kids to skate this great park.  It has everything from beginners to advance obstacles. Lots of grinding rails and 3 bowls to skate.  One looks like a old swimming pool and is awesome.
Really neat and clean place for kids. Cool skate park and play ground. Lots of soccer fields and what looks like walking trails. Also some baseball fields as well.

Incredible park to visit!!! I've only gone once so far, but I'm already wanting to visit again!!! The skaters are pretty cool to watch and the park also has an herbal garden that you can sample and a zipline for kids & adults!!! Very nice park! Great for a family outing!!! 👍👍👏👏🤗😍

For a walk-up public park it's pretty darn good! Scooters, rollerblades, skateboards, bikes all welcome. Sometimes the language gets a bit colorful, but the locals are great to support and encourage kids to learn and grow.

name: Saluda Shoals
address: 6071 St Andrews Rd, Columbia, SC 29212, USA
reviews: Today was my first time at Saluda Shoals park and I have to say that the new playground is absolutely beautiful. I love the turf so kids can be safe and as care free to able to just worry about playing ( which should be every kids only responsibility). My daughter had a blast running up and down the ramp. I love the fact that its made also for kids that may have disabilities or not capable of using their motor skills normally. I love the over look of the small pond which is guarded with a fence and the small waterfall that just relaxes the atmosphere. I really love everything about it.

I've always loved coming here for walks and fishing. Recently we bought the fisherman's pass for my husband. $65 and we can go 24hrs. No more $5 parking. The pass is 100% worth the money. Also if you have little ones the splash pad is wonderful. Its $3 for each person. They have so many different sprinklers. Just watch for the bigger kids and don't forget sunscreen. They have picnic tables and a playground right next to it. It makes for a perfect family day.
Love this area.  Kayaking with old friends. My friend Shawn took me here.  Rip.   He had a season pass and we would kayak.  Walk the dogs.  Have lots of fun
A great place to walk by yourself or with your dog.  Trails are paved and wide.  There are also dirt trails off the paved trail that you can go right up to the river.

I absolutely love the new Leo's Landing park! It's amazing to finally have an affordable, all inclusive play location for children in Columbia!  It has something for everyone. I could even see it being a great location to have an Occupational Therapy field trip! I honestly cannot say enough good things about this park. 

Saluda Shoals was fun to visit before Leo's Landing; so many trails, a splash pad, river access, etc. But Leo's Landing is definitely our favorite part now! Thank you for providing a safe place to play for our community.

name: Emily Douglas Park
reviews: We take our dog here all the time. It's a nice park in a nice neighborhood and you can walk around in the neighborhood too. Currently there are so many different kind of mushrooms growing in the wild which I find quite fascinating. They have a children's area and a separate dog park too.

There was too much gravel for the dogs to run around on. It should either be grass or sand. A lot of people just leave their dogs poop lying around. They do have 2 places to get water for the dogs and there are a lot of tennis balls laying around. The only "plus side" to this park was that it is free and located in a nice area.
Great park, dog park and playground in the beautiful outdoors. Very family-friendly and safe. Highly recommend!
It allowed me to gather myself this morning!

Its the only dog park that is free in the area. It needs some improvement; lots of mosquitos & sand. But because its free, people keep going and that means there is usually a few dogs there at any time. My dog is always worn out after and sleeps well for hours. If you need your dog to get out some energy, go here for free. (see pic below).

name: Broad River Canal Riverfront Park
reviews: Another positively awesome day @Broad River Canal. The weather was great, not to hot nice breeze the pollen was low. The human & animal traffic was mild but tolerable w/a German beer festival starting as I was leaving... I 💛 nature. I have enclosed a few pictures of the canal & some of the scenary. Enjoy!!! 😎💃🏽☀🚲👟🍻🌳🌾🍃🍁🍂🌷🌼
Very nice. 2.5 mile walk each way, so you easily do 5 miles. Very pretty - one of the few things I like about Columbia.

I love this place. It's peaceful. There are restrooms. Check for TP before you sit! Not always clean because not everyone received the same home training and they abuse the privilege.
There are paved asphalt trails that run along the canal and there are sidewalk trails that run along a portion of the Broad River that feeds the canal. It's a great place for exercising, strolling, or taking pictures. Some people get in the water at the river. There is no lifeguard and this is not recommended! Don't do this!
The canal trail is connected to the Riverfront Park. Partially shaded along portions of the trail. Great views!
Parking usually isn't a problem. Do not leave any valuables in your car. Do not leave your car unlocked. Do not leave anything visible in your car either. Again, not everyone has home training and there is no video surveillance.
Best trail to walk in Columbia. Since I moved to Columbia 21 years ago. Every time I walk this 5.3 miles great satisfaction.
It's one of Columbia's hidden gems. I love walking, biking and fishing there. Most of all I love the covered sitting areas.

name: Woodrow Wilson Family Home
reviews: If you are interested in Reconstruction or the Wilson family,  this home has a lot of stories to tell,  enhanced with a guide who fills out detail in very educational and entertaining ways.  We collect Presidential homes and are glad to have visited this one.

I didnt realize Woodrow Wilson had grown up in Columbia. The garden was simple but interesting nonetheless. A plant in backyard looked like the largest thistle I have ever seen. Didnt get to traverse the inside of home because I arrived too early but I believe it was well worth seeing. Wilson was noted for guiding U.S. through WW1 and I believe he was instrumental in the League of Nations, the forerunner to the United Nations.
Great place to learn some American history. Amazing tour guides! Brought my family to visit from Omaha, Nebraska and they loved it, too
Great tour, so much history. Learned a few things I never knew or heard of.
So much History. Beautiful Gardens. His parents are buried down the Street.

name: Earlewood Park
reviews: You could just come and set up for a party. You don't have to pay or anything , just in case its last minute. The area is Very nice and clean. There's sections for picnics, music events, kids playground, dog park and nothing interferes with each other. Its awesome

Noma Bark Park is a nice safe place for your pets to run free located at the N
 Main  entrance of Earlwood Park. Again, have no reservations about your safety, because there is a nearly constant police and/or park ranger and/or parks & recreation staff presence. There are also 3 baseball fields, tennis court, outdoor full court basketball goals, disc golf course and an amphitheater. One of my favorite places to play ball

We like going to this course. It's very spread out and if it has rained, it doesn't stay as wet as some of the flatter courses like 7 Oaks. I love the hills because it feels almost as if you're in the mountains.
Loved playing kickball here!
Great location and very spacious.  Had my sister's gradation party here and was easily able to fit 50 plus. Projector used and good parking.

name: Seven Oaks Park
reviews: Get place to play around of disc golf. Well kept. And plenty of parking. Has a nice picnic area as well. It is handicap ramps as well. Baseball fields are well maintained. It has a kids park as well recommended age is 12 but i think younger kids would like it as well.

This is a nice little neighborhood park. I enjoy walking my dogs here in the fall. This is an ICRC park, so it is pretty well kept. There is a semiannual bulletin that is mailed out to residents in the area detailing seasonal activities. I haven't been in the main building, the Leisure Center, very often in the last few years because I don't go to the park to be indoors. The last time I was in there was right after the renovations a few years back. It was a nice looking facility at the time.

There are several athletic fields here, I often see youth sports teams practicing. Frisbee golf is popular, there is a nice course here. There are picnic shelters, playgrounds, and trails to walk as well. A stream runs along one edge of the park, basically separating it from the neighborhood behind. There is a bridge that allows you to cross over.

Parking is typically not an issue, they have two large lots. There are restrooms available down by the athletic fields and of course, in the Leisure Center. There isn't a lot of light in the park area at night unless the athletic fields are in use, but the area around the Leisure Center is well lit.

I very regularly go here to play a casual round of disc golf. Very nice facility. One thing to keep in mind is that the ground doesn't absorb water very well, so even days after a rain, the place is very wet and muddy. 

There's very nice playground equipment here as well, so it's a great place to bring the younger family. Ball fields surround the area. Multiple parking lots. Also a recreation center. ( I haven't been inside this one)

The park is part of Irmo Chapin recreation.

I love this park!

The playground is nice, and layered with recycled tires so no worry of splinters like with some parks. Not a lick of shade so it's almost impossible to stay very long considering it doesn't open until 2pm, when it's the most hot during the day.
The lunch program for the seniors is great!!!! And the bingo on Wednesdays is fun to!!!!

name: Boyd Plaza
reviews: Big improvement over the old design to accommodate large crowds. Nice shaded area to relax. Very functional
Great redesign in 2019.  The since it's now much more livable with multiple seating options.  A great spot to eat your lunch outside
Great events. Beautiful spot. Very well done all the way around. Oh, did I mention the Columbia Museum of Art? Two thumbs up.

Quiet peaceful sitting area right in the middle of downtown Columbia. City Life rolling with a little piece of heaven with Functioning modern abstract designed fountain with wishing well to make your wishes come true. Charging ports for phones and laptops. Good place to work or study, and eat with friends or business partners. If you have kids, there is a children's area shaded by trees. With a turf covered area Incase you want to lay back...
The redone space is wonderful for hanging out and having a snack Frome the Soda City Market.

name: U.S. Army Basic Combat Training Museum
reviews: This was a nice stop to visit and view some military history.  I love to take my kids to these types of museums to let them see what our armed forces have used and currently use while protecting our country.
Very interesting  . Loved it. . Must see

A great place to learn about Army basic combat training. Shows a historical overview of initial entry training. My 6 and 4 year olds loved the museum. The tanks on display outside are awesome. On the inside, there are many hands on and interactive exhibits. My son loved getting mad at the drill sergeant hologram.
Very informative as to what tour soldier endures and learns. Great that it's free too. Lots to look at. Really loved it!
Very nice and numerous interactive displays even had a drill sergeant yelling via hologram which scared my son and hubby...the veteran and current soldier. Highly recommended.

name: Southeast Park
reviews: The best park in the immediate Columbia area, it is worth the drive to it from downtown. Great disc golf course, some beautiful oaks, and a nice place for a walk. It also has a ton of tennis courts, a kayak/canoe friendly pond, and some nice open fields (not completely flat).
Beautiful park with nice walking trails. Always feel safe and comfortable there. The pond loop is 1/2 mile and sometime disc golfers are on the trail but I’ve never had a problem. My go to park!
I love feeding the 🐢 here great place for family fun

A somewhat hidden gem.  Unless you live in the Lower Richland area, you may not have visited or even know about Southeast Park.    Situated just off of 378/76, it feels like you are further out into nature than that.  Well done walking trails and the best disc golf course in the area, it's worth a visit.
Nice quiet place to walk around or fish. A little on the small side but great place to get away from the city.

name: Community Park of Irmo
reviews: Love this place with nice and clean play ground and beautiful park area as well. One of the best community parks in cola.

Looking around for a new place to live (we aren't from around here) and came across this park. Very cool park. A major plus to living near it. It's obvious that many people of the community came together with a lot of great ideas to make this place happen.
Well lit. Very clean. Public restrooms. Picnic shelters. Walking path. Great playground. Parking is difficult during peak months. Patrolled regularly by law enforcement.

raffles. Shelters for picnics. Large level. Area for volleyball football soccer etc. We held our outdoor baptism for 11 members of Onelife community church. Perfect place with built in seating. Bri g umbrellas for shade in sun. Nice platform for musicians. Beautiful setup.

I liked it. A newer park in Irmo. There is
a bandstand and cement seating area, play area(jungle gym etc) sandboxes swings seesaws restrooms and good parking. Hours are in photos at each of two gates. Mommies with little tots walking about made it look like a safe place to read while I waited for my car nearby at Eurowerkz. Thanks Lex. or Richland Counties & the Town of Irmo in any case.

name: Maxcy Gregg Park
reviews: Clean, well designed park. Good for a short walk. A road runs beside, so you don't feel completely isolated.

Very nice place to go for a walk and there are three places to go in that area. and yes they have homeless people sleeping in the parks but they are people having a hard time. Put yourself in their place. But all in all I wasn't worried about anything and park trucks were making their rounds checking out the parks and cleaning the park Great parks to walk in and spend the day.

The park is nice. A calm place to walk
And relax. Not a place to visit at night
alone. But during the day...it is a 
Beautiful park. Day swings in the main part. Benches to sit on. Walking trails
No Bathrooms !
Some homeless around the park. Not many people hang around on Sat
No 9nexwas there when I got there on the 4th

name: Greenview Park
reviews: Loved it. Kiddy pool was a little dirty but other than that......great place!! Very fun
The water park was well attended and very clean.  Great family atmosphere!

Nice park, in a random part of town. My son enjoyed himself. Only issue was the rude employee that yelled at me for eating in the park. I was unaware that food wasnt allowed and felt attacked by the older gentleman that worked there.
Greenville Park was one of the parks that had a swimming program. My granddaughters loved going to the pool there in the summer.  Best tennis program among all the parks.
Greenview Park is my go to place.  Exercise classes....line dancing & areobics!!!  Moral is wonderful...we are FAMILY....😆😆😆😆

name: NOMA (North Main) Bark Park
reviews: Went to have Santa pictures made and was able to walk around and check it out. This place is great! Can't actually go in yet because my pups aren't fixed. That's my only problem with this and other dog parks, as a vet tech I know the benefits of not fixing your pups until their growth plates have closed so they don't have arthritis problems later in life but dog parks won't allow you to bring them not fixed. If owners are responsible you can keep accidents from happening if they aren't fixed. Other than that I absolutely LOVED the place itself and it's amenities.
All the bad reviews are super dumb. It’s a great place for $30 a year. Yes, your dogs need to be up to date on shots. Probably not a bad idea.

I do not have a dog, but was here on business.   There are wide open places for dogs to run, and even a place where they can jump into the creek.  Plenty  of parking. Looks like a good place for puppies to have fun!
My Beagle loves the new playground equipment!

Been a member for the 3rd year. LOVE THIS PARK! All breeds of dogs and people. Is a comfort to know that ALL the dogs have had their shots and there will never be accidental puppies. And all are registered with the city.

name: Capital City/Lake Murray Country RTB
address: 2184 N Lake Dr, Columbia, SC 29212, USA
reviews: I attended the Lake Murray Christmas boat parade. It was a very pleasant experience and I loved how pretty the boats were. I also loved the fireworks show and I loved how the fireworks mostly contained the Christmas colors. It was a very nice treat and I hope that it will be brought back next year. I'm happy to be a resident of Lake Murray.☺
I love Lake Murray great boat ramp at the dam clean water except in the children's area of the park
Everyone should visit this place. Wonderful information and a Great little gift shop.😊👍

Great place to get your local information!  They have a lot of brochures, a Lake Murray Map, History museum and even some Lake Murray gifts, shirts, hats and more.... They are very friendly and quite helpful! Definitely worthy of stopping in:)
This is my happy place. I love it.

name: Heathwood Park
reviews: Really nice shady park in the Heathwood neighborhood.  One picnic shelter, tennis courts, handball court, two play areas, and an activities building.  Not a lot of benches, but enough that we could all sit.  It was a pleasant surprise and we'll go back.
Great for playing
My kids love this place
Nice little neighborhood park for the kids and their elders to have fun for a while
This is a vast and well-kept park, with multiple areas for kids to play. The trees surrounding the area are great to provide shade during the hot months.

name: Trenholm Park
reviews: The fields are clean.  The fields are sectioned off adequately.   Bleachers are available, dugouts available.  Excellent family atmosphere.   My only concern is the lack of parking.
It is a awesome place to play baseball and softball. It has a minor league and major
We had a birthday party there nice and clean place.

The little park was pretty fun but my nephew and i visited at a bad time. There are renovations going on at the moment so we werent able to go swimming at this park but looks fun and there were older boys playing baseball. Looked like they were having fun. Will visit again later.
Great staff and nice park.

name: Icehouse Amphitheater
address: 107 W Main St, Lexington, SC 29072, USA
reviews: Very well kept amphitheater. Parking was off-site due to the parking lot being so small, but still not a bad experience by any stretch. A short walk at most. The staff was friendly and efficient. The restrooms were very well kept. Would absolutely come back to this venue.

Really love this place in the middle of Lexington. Kids really love free movie nights and always a ton a free kids events. Love when the beer festival is held there as well. Maybe some sort of ramp from the bottom side parking would be nice rather than walking over by the road

What a wonderful place! This is a gem right in the downtown area of Lexington! We spent a Friday evening there enjoying the Battle of the Bands fundraiser for the MDA. This amphitheater has a comfortable, relaxing vibe set in front of a pretty wooded area. Definitely recommend fun a fun outing with friends and family!
Really enjoyed this amphitheater! Great comfortable seating with grass. Parking was a bit tricky, but if you get there early you should be fine.
Had a great time at the Thursday concert. The free Thursday concert series is a wonderful opportunity for the community to enjoy the new downtown in Lexington

name: Timmerman Trail
reviews: Great trail for walking/running/biking,  only draw back is we found no restrooms. There should be at least  port o potties at beginning and 1or2 down the trail. Still it was all paved concrete. Extremely nice with that one exception. Law enforcement was traveling down trail on four wheelers. Another plus.
Great place to walk, run, or ride your bike. Signage could be a little better. Wish they had mile markers.

My family biked over 7 miles here yesterday and we all loved it! Even though it had been raining for several days prior, the trails were in good shape and safe. The woods and trails are beautiful and give you the sense that you're away in the mountains. We saw a deer and two snakes along the river bank along with your typical woodland birds and squirrels. The trails are wide enough to pass others without fear of running one another off the path. The park IS pet friendly. There are multiple parking areas, so do be sure to check signage if you're meeting up with others. This is an awesome (and not overly crowded) place to go on a date, have a family outing or just exercise alone. Although I have not personally been in the evenings I did notice that they have ample lighting and emergency call boxes. There are picnic tables and benches, so it's a lovely place to get your picnic on. I have been twice and definitely plan to return.
Very nice paved path. Good for walking Poppa. Hiking and bike as well

Great trail to walk, run, or bike. Make sure you bring water. There are no restrooms on the trail. Shady paved trail paths and scenic river views. Several bridges to walk over as well. The trail extends to neighborhood in Cayce that connects to another section of the trail that has been closed since the Oct flood a few years ago. The trail paths are wider than most paved trails which makes it better for biking. The trail is maintained, and free of debris. There is also a trail that leads to the creek for canoe access. The trail head is also easy to find and beautiful in the Spring and Fall.

name: Lake Murray Dam North Recreational Area
address: 2101 N Lake Dr, Columbia, SC 29212, USA
reviews:
Get out of the house and enjoy yourself. Lake Murray is a great place to relax and pass the time away. Young and old will like being out in the sun looking at and playing on the water. Free fun for all, fishing for the sportsman, boating for the water activites or just a drift on the water.
The damn is nice for the walk and many use it for this. Get out of the house and enjoy life! No excuses.

Fantastic location close to the capital to check out lakeside life.  A well kept park with plenty of picnic tables and charcoal grills to afford family and friends a cozy place with beautiful views allowing for a day time escape.  The location has a boat ramp, fishing dock and a ramp for kayaks and canoes.
Love the walk and view. I'm new to this area, and I am looking forward to warm days and lake walks. Beautiful area!
It is always a good place to take the kids for some outdoor time. The views are great, especially at sunset or on a kayak!
Peaceful and beach like feel. Plenty of activities can be done. Lake has so many picnic spots. Columbia's pride.

name: Congaree National Park
address: 100 National Park Rd, Hopkins, SC 29061, USA
reviews: One of the most unique National Parks I have been to.  Spent the afternoon walking the boardwalk through the swamp and seeing a ton of wildlife.  4 snakes and a box turtle, some fascinating beetles, and a whole lot of squirrels.  A must see for any nature-lovers in the area.
This was awesome. It's a flood plain forest. It was so flooded we could not hike the trails. The video the ranger showed us was good. The ranger was very nice. Maybe next time we can enjoy it more.

2.5 mile boardwalk, just reopen today because of flooding. Flooding is a understatement, The water was feet high above the trees. Remnants of the park benches being underwater are very visible. Lots of birds and wildlife. The trees were absolutely amazing! ** this is a must do!!

Great for family walks and picnics. Great for little ones. Just pack a snack and being your camera. There is sometimes flooding so tennis shoes or boots are advised! Go into the visitor center and also do some Geocaching! (Download the app)

A short boardwalk makes up the easy hiking portion of this park. There are backcountry trails with views of lakes and trees. Some nice features like tree 'knees' and good views of the water. It is fairly quiet in the later hours of the day and a good time to feel like you are surrounded by nature. Check if the floodplain has flooded the trails before you go.

name: Congaree Creek Heritage Preserve
address: 634 Old State Rd, Cayce, SC 29033, USA
reviews: Favorite place to hike in Columbia. Unique ecosystem full of wildlife just across river from city. Alligators, snakes, deer, otters, and birds of prey seen on a regular basis, especially if you know where to look.

If you live in Columbia, SC and you want to get away from the city for a short trip, this is the place to go. 10 min drive and you are walking on trails and encounters the wildlife. Make sure to bring food and water. And I recommend bug stray in the Summer.
Typical swamp wetland heritage preserve with decent parking lot and trail.
A beautiful natural area, especially for wildlife viewing, not that far out of downtown Columbia
Beautiful trail to walk down. Me and some friends seen a baby gator down there

name: Cayce Historical Museum
reviews: This is a beautiful museum with so much history. Take advantage of their tour and other fun family activities!

A True hidden gem. Like a little village from the past. Makes a visit to the nearby Cayce River walk much mire interesting !   Staff is So knowledgeable and helpful. Plan to spend an hour or more in museum and walking the grounds. Beauty park with nature trails and a Cinderella pumpkin coach !! Beware the Wildlife !!!
A interesting place, it takes your mind back to how it use to be for others. Yet beautiful to view.
Excellent place to go with adults or children. Children's playground walking trail, Museum, historical buildings. Birthday parties.
A relaxing place go visit.

name: Virginia Hylton Park
reviews: Our First time here & it's an amazing park. One of Lexington County's hidden gems. Beautiful park layout with lots of shade. Very clean with lots of benches and tables with covered tops. Very safe and secure children's paradise tucked behind the Lexington Municipal building. Very clean restrooms with water fountain. Highly recommend to all parents.

Beautiful park that also has swing sets and a playground for both children and children with special needs. Part of the park is being redone to make it even better. Flower galore! Many paths and gazebos. Benches for resting. Little waterfalls and rivers. Cute, quaint, and a nice place to take little ones or just contemplate.

Park is great for kids, it's behind a police station so I assume it's safe, I chopped off 1 star due to the ground being very unstable on one side alot of roots and drop offs, the equipment could use a little upgrading but kids enjoy it you just have to watch them, obviously. It's fully handicap accessible and the view is nice, been there many times never had a bad one.. at the park that is!

We go to the park often and we love it for a walking exercise. However the walking trail is in need of repair as roots from trees have formed large cracks in the walk path. Be careful especially with little ones.

This park is beautiful and unique! There are two play structures and plenty of swings for all ages go children. I love how it’s tight in the middle of downtown yet with all the trees it feels like a little oasis. The police station is right by the parking lot which provides and additional peace of mind. I have kids ranging in ages from 12-2 and they all enjoy what Virginia Hylyon has to offer. This is the best park in the area by far!

name: Bomb Island
reviews: The Purple Martin migration is amazing to experience and as a bonus enjoy some of the most beautiful sunsets you’ll ever see
I love lake Murray. Best recreational lake I've ever put my house boat in !! Love watching the birds on bomb island . Always drop anchor close and admire.
The purple Martins are an awesome sunset site to see! Mother nature is incredible! Do not miss the beautiful sunset and unique experience if the Purple Martins!
Definitely a must see when on Lake Murray.
Beautiful place to see purple Martins.

name: North Springs Park
reviews: Nice community center.  Modern and open plan.  Clean restrooms.  Open play ground.
Very poor attitude of people need some Christmas spirit peoples very clean in the areas of the gym

They have a basketball court that is never open because the community obviously doesn’t need a court. Oh and if you bring a backpack with basketball shoes in it expect to have to go all the way back home to drop off your backpack cause black people cant bring bags in.
I went to see PCW for the first time and I had a blast! Great price for ring side seats. Awesome entertainment. Very pleased. I'll most definitely be back for other events.
Decent park with a playground, two baseball fields, and a soccer field

name: Dreher Island State Park
address: 3677 State Park Rd, Prosperity, SC 29127, USA
reviews: Great view
Our favorite getaway for a picnic, camping, fishing.

Just a great place to visit, but there is a couple of things I think they could improve here though. Adding a few more ramps and adding some more docking area around the ramps. To say this is suppose to be Murray's mega landing for big tournaments, it's kinda disappointing.

Cool outing for a weekend. With Villas, boating, trailing it gives a good option for a small group, a large group or even for a single person to lay down, relax or fish or swim- you decide the way for your fun. The entry fee is just $2 per adult and free for kids.
Had a great family reunion and the place is very well kept

name: Riverfront Park Amphitheater
address: Three Rivers Greenway, Columbia, SC 29201, USA
reviews: Great trail along the canal to run or ride your bike. It goes on a good few miles and is a nice place to exercise or walk.
Great place for walk, nice view and people run or walking with dogs. Is very peaceful.

Excellent trail to walk and exercise. 
It has a open gym.
Public restrooms available.
Free parking.
Nice stroll or bike along a flat paved trail along the river.
Nice park. Good place to bike or bring your dog. Has a few PokeStops if that's what you're looking for.

name: Historic Columbia Foundation
reviews: The Seibels House is a beautiful historic home and the christmas party was a great event to have there.

This hard working group has preserved historic buildings for Columbia's citizens to enjoy. Their tours are fantastic. They stepped up and prevented our iconic landmarks from being razed when no one else would!

We went to the candle light Christmas  evening  event it was a let down it was supposed  to be how people  of columbia   celebrate  Christmas  but most of the decorations  were plastic  most of the tour guides were not as knowledgeable  ha some would think  Hampton Preston home  -Robert Mills plastic reefs on the front doors it was a chaotic  experience  the horse and buggy ride we paid for was around the block in a wagon drawn by  mules or donkeys veey short and uncomfortable  ride  soaking wet seats so we went on the tour with wet pants the staff was in running  at the last minute unprepared .they did have a choir that really sound good while we should out in the rain waiting what seemed like a long time to finely  get in only to get only one Christmas  Carol when we did get in the house no one would take the time to tell where to go or what to do then the rushed us through the house it was over before it started it seemed I will say that one tour guide did do a great job was very knowledgeable Rose Mary she is English sad a brit knows more about the history  of  our land marks then the rest of the.lical tour guides who didn't seem to know anything only rushed us through  and where not  very friendly my advise for next year to the poor folks that were there with us is save your 50.00 dollars next year and go across the river to the Lexington museum  were the Christmas event is free long lasting friendly  in coustum  guides and plenty of free food and refreshments with real demonstrations of how it was in those days lit fire places blacksmith  and even enslaved people working in the kitchen columbia  historic said there would be hot chocolate  we saw none
I went to the Mann-Simons House. It was an awesome experience and the museum was incredibly well kept.
Peaceful

name: Cola's Restaurant
reviews: Best food ever! Everything tasted fresh! My office had our Christmas party here, and we had 2 great waitstaff. They were on top of everything!! So professional!

This restaurant was great. It was my first time there. I was celebrating a birthday. My meal was AMAZING. I got the pan seared salmon. With double vegies. I told them to hold the risotto. Midway through the meal someone hit a transformer and all the lights went out on the whole block. We ended up eating in the dark. I would have given this restaurant 5 stars because they could have compensated us with like a free dessert on the next visit or 10% off of our meal. It was not there fault but we where ear eating in the dark. They did provide tea lit candles but they did not provide much lighting. So for that reason they get a 3 star.

Love this spot and it’s usually really easy to get a reservation on a Friday night. I usually get the BBQ pulled porked egg rolls for an app, and the roasted chicken for the entree. The food never misses the mark. I visited last night for dinner and our waitress was less than attentive and the food took forever to come out. We continuously had to request things like bread and refills that other tables seemed to get with no issue.

Set your reservations and be prepared to be amazed. The menu is unique,  the service is fantastic. The cuisine is something I've never experienced before, I had herbed grits and beef spare ribs the first visit. When I heard the two in the same sentence,  it kind of threw me off...but guys, it was absolutely amazing. My second visit was just as superb as the first, never ceasing to amaze.  This place ranks very high with me.

Super service, great ambience, fantastic sweet tea. Shrimp Savannah, fresh bread, poached pear salad wonderful. Not impressed by braised beef or fish almondine. Vanilla bean ice cream delicious. Very pricey, not quite worth it at that price point, but still a very good meal.

name: Saluda's Restaurant
reviews: I was passing through SC for a special event and Saluda was a wonderful Cap to the night. Fine dining meets Southern Comfort with a charm that will whisk you away. The appetizers were delightfully original. I was in love with the Shrimp and Grits because the dish is packed with more surprises and flavor then the name suggests. Lastly, the red wine velvet cake was to die for. YOU MUST DINE HERE!

Delicious!! But very expensive. Definitely a special treat place. I had the fish of the day and it was probably the best fish I've ever had. My boyfriend loved the pork chop. The sweet potato hash and Brussel sprouts AMAZING and the pumpkin cheesecake HEAVENLY

Wonderful evening. Wonderful space. Wonderful service. Wonderful food. On an unexpectedly busy mid-week evening, we were treated to great service and great food. I had the pork chop. She (a vegetarian) had the stuffed acorn squash. Both cooked and presented expertly. Strong wine list to complement our food.

Booked a table for busy parents weekend far in advance and then needed to change the time AND number of guests. They were great! Let me add 3 people and change our time. Food was excellent. Everyone ordered something different and everyone raved about their dinner. I had shrimp and grits were the best he’s ever had (sorry, Bobby Flay) and daughter’s steak was perfectly cooked. Waitress recommended the steak special (can’t remember the exact name) and everyone who ordered it loved the choice. I would definitely go back on next visit to Columbia.
Great food, great service. Very accommodating to allergies. Excellent wine selection, good beer selection, and nice atmosphere.

name: Midwood Smokehouse
address: 702 Cross Hill Rd 400 D, Columbia, SC 29205, USA
reviews: Delicious, smoked BBQ! When you can smell it cooking outside, you know it's gotta be good inside! Loved the brisket and love they allow you to choose what pieces you like and how well it's cooked. Wait staff was friendly, very accommodating, and shared info on their different house made sauces and allowed me to try each! Will definitely go again!
