Food was good, wait was short for a Saturday night. My extended family and I all loved the dishes. The cornbread is a must!
Long wait times with no real area to wait is my only real issue... the food is consistently fantastic and the burnt ends are some of the best I have had in SC... this is a good place

The food comes out fast here! Fast but still hot and good. They do a lot of take out because people kept coming to pickup food and I don't blame them because it's GOOD! Great flavor and good portions. I had the small Carolina Pork plate with Hash & Rice as the side kick to the pork. Hush puppies and some cucumber, onion, and jalapeño pepper slaw thingy (trust me this thingy tastes great!). I inhaled all of this down real fast because I was hungry and not greedy. Oh I can't forget the service. Great service with a side of smiles. The draft beer is fresh clean, cold and refreshing. I hate getting draft beer from some places and it has a sour taste! Not here... It's good. Well that's about it... About it for this review but not for the food. I ordered some smoked & crispy wings to go. Again because I'm hungry and NOT greedy...

It here on our road trip back from Florida to Canada. Definitely glad we made the stop because the food was amazing and the mac and cheese was even better! My boyfriend and I had the pig out which was more than enough food for the both of us. I would stop in if you're looking for a good barbecue🙂

A solid BBQ place.  Good food, good prices.  I've been there for weekend and weekday lunches. The service and food was the same for both; definitely a place that can turn tables with a crowd. The bacon wrapped jalapenos were some of the best I've ever had.  The menu doesn't have nutrition information, but you can still make some smart choices -- and if that's not your thing, you can certainly go unhealthy!  Overall a solid choice.

name: Menkoi Ramen House
reviews: Attn: Owner(s)~ I just wanted to give a HUGE shout out to your sweet, kind, efficient and genius of an employee from this past Saturday night. How does he do it? Super powers? I think so!! He remembers where everyone is seated while calmly taking orders for people with a line out the door. Mesmerizing!! He deserves a huge raise or cut of the pie.. so to speak. lol!

BEST NOODS YOU'LL FIND THIS SIDE OF TEXAS 🤤🤤🤤 My husband and I have weekly dates at Menkoi and today was no different!  So happy they were still open for pickup orders!  Quick and easy and as delicious as always!
First time here was great!! I loved it. Food was great. I saw a lot of reviews recommending the Spicy Ramen & it was so good. Customer was also amazing!! Definitely coming back!
This place is great and still offering to-go food during the issues we are having. The Spicy Ramen has been my favorite for some time. Customer service is also top notch!

This spot is my favored. I go to plenty of restaurants but to this one I go the most. The stuff is very friendly and the cuisine they cook is so good. I am always happy to have a nice dinner in this place. I recommend this place with pleasure.

name: Pearlz Oyster Bar
reviews: This place had a great environment. It gave me a sports bar and grill feel.  And of course I was there for the oysters. I am certainly not a fan of oysters but if I were, I can imagine I would have enjoyed these. The prices were in between expensive and cheap so there was something for everyone's. I will visit again.
I was very surprised by how much I enjoyed the food here. We had 10 dishes and all were amazing. Then I just had to waddle next door for dessert too. Well done Pearlz.
WOW...Food and staff were fabulous! Wife & I ordered several items off the Happy Hour Menu (until 7:00). We will definitely be back. Little bit of a drive for us but we'll make an exception.

Enjoyed a wonderful dinner today at Pearlz. We came in right after 4 on a Friday with no wait and were seated immediately. We were met with a kind and knowledgeable waitress who recommended the Crab Dip appetizer which was full of flavor and by itself a respectable portion. After ordering the Shrimp and Grits by the waitresses recommendation I was greater by a beautifully presented plate with creamy filling grits and flavorful breaded shrimp that gave a nice crunch to the dish. The music selection was good and the lowlight setting gave the place a tasteful ambiance. I look forward to coming again to this great restaurant
Awesome oysters! Very friendly and helpful staff. Connected dessert parlor. Not too busy in the afternoon to pop in for a snack.

name: Oyster Bar Columbia
reviews: First time here and was quite impressed! Guys shocked oysters pretty quick and we had no issues with little shell pieces left behind in our oysters! Highly recommend their oyster shooters! We will definitely be returning!

Me and my wife have been coming here for over 10 years. Unpretentious, just good oysters at a good price. The other stuff on the menu is good too, but come for the oysters and watch them shuck them fresh in front of you. Always tip your shucker!!
The crab was delicious. Their clam chowder was amazing. Would recommend 5/5. You can just chill at the bar while waiting on tables.
1st time here. All the seafood is steamed. Modelo's but no Red Stripe 😥.... This was a pretty cool spot! Will definitely be back!
I went here after hours Saturday. Pretty cool night life with great drinks. Very diverse crowd.

name: Hampton Street Vineyard
reviews: Sweet potato coconut milk soup was amazing! Lunch dish I had was the salmon with rice noodles. It was a little too sweet for my taste, but not bad.

Enjoyed a wonderful dinner last Friday Nov 1. Stephen/Steven, was our waiter and did and excellent job. Our last visit wasn't the best so we decided to give them another shot and they did not disappoint. The dusted Oysters app was superb, followed by a great soup and then we split the special Halibut. Incredible dinner and excellent service. Glad to know we will be back as this is one of our favorite restaurants in Columbia.
The atmosphere is super chill. Very simple yet sophisticated. The food was fantastic. The service is excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

Too often will restaurants treat to-go lunch salads too lightly. Pun intended, no one likes 95% lettuce and 5% toppings. You know the salad I'm talking about, where the toppings are scantily scattered over a thick forest beneath. This place did no such thing. The salad included an ample amount of almonds, blue cheese, and strawberries. In fact, they could've added too many strawberries, or included the ones with yucky bruises or fibrous green stems, but instead they included just enough perfectly cut red treasures to conserve appreciation for each bite that included one. The Atlantic salmon filet on top was crispy and cooked medium rare. Phenomenal salad. No wonder it cost $18! For context, in Columbia, SC, an $18 salad is exorbitant.
Great place to eat lunch or Dinner, today I had the Tuna dish, so fresh and tasty! Loved it

name: The Southern Belly BBQ
reviews: We saw Southern Belly BBQ on Yelp on our way back home from Asheville,  NC. Great BBQ, liked by the entire family! I had the signature sauce traditional sandwich. I ordered the pork on the side for my daughters grilled cheese. My son lived the Southern Belly.

Simply Breathtaking. Took several days to gather myself after having a lunch here. Fantastic, authentic, BBQ food. EXPLOSIVE sauces. Fries curled to perfection. Did I mention the sauces? This place is a must visit if in Columbia.
Amazing food! Delicious bread to go with that meat! Not alot of fat at all. Higher price for better quality anyday.
Awesome place. Must check it out. Order your sandwich and then choose the sauce. Be ready! You’ll need a nap afterward:)

Extremely disappointed!! So I've dined at this establishment for lunch on a few occasions in the past, with no problems whatsoever! Until recently, when me and a coworker went there for lunch (Thursday). Well, the next day (Friday) when I checked my bank account (I tend to do this on a daily basis with the risk of fraud being so high), I noticed that my card was charged twice for lunch. So basically, I was being charged two payments of $15.75 for lunch. No big deal....I figured the waitress accidentally swiped my card twice without realizing it, because my coworker and I told her that we were paying separately and we both had our own individual bills that we paid with our cards. Well, when I contacted the establishment the next day (Friday), I was told by a young lady that I will receive a refund for the additional amount, and to expect a call from the manager once the refund has been processed. To my surprise, I never received a call from the manager or anyone. So on Monday, I contacted the establishment again and asked to speak to the manager. The manager was the person that actually answered the phone, and when I explained to him what had happened and that I was waiting on his call, of course, the manager didn't have a clue what I was talking about!!! He seemed very friendly and was very apologetic. He told me that he would process my refund immediately, and call me back the minute it was done. NO CALL WAS MADE!!! I called again on Tuesday and left a message for the manager, because he was not there when I called, and here it is on Wednesday, and I still have not heard from the manager or anyone!!! This screams POOR MANAGEMENT!!! The last thing you want your establishment to portray is that you knowingly take STEAL money from your customers, and that you don't even have the decency to reach out and resolve the issue...POOR MANAGEMENT SKILLS!!! I will NEVER eat at Southernbelly BBQ on Harden St. EVER AGAIN!!! My advise to anyone that dines at this establishment, is to pay with cash and if you pay with a debit/credit card, be sure to check your bank account after dining here!!!!

name: Rioz Brazilian Steakhouse
reviews: Last night was my first night here and I was celebrating my girlfriends birthday. I wasn't prepared for what was about to happen. They give you a circular card one side is green and the other is red. Green means you want food to keep coming to your table and red obviously means stop. I kid you not literally every other minute there was someone coming around with different meats to try. The steaks were delicious. The inside is extremely nice and gives you a luxurious feel to it. It makes you feel important. If you love to eat this is the place for you. I was stuffed within the first 10 minutes. I will be coming back. This time I am prepared. Best place I've eaten at in a long time. Extremely friendly staff as well.

The food was absolutely wonderful. I'm giving this place 4 stars because the customer service could've been a lot better. My server only came to the table twice: To give me my drink, and then to give me my check. I didn't receive a refill on my drink, and she didn't check in to see if everything was okay. It's seems like the only person who was very welcoming and concerned about my stay was the manager. He was warm and hospitable to all the guests. The rest of the employees need to learn about quality customer service.

Stopped by with the wife and kids last night and I must say I had a wonderful experience. Great atmosphere, we had more than our fill and were never left with an empty plate! The manager stopped by to check on our experience and we assured her this will be a frequent stop for our family from now on! 10/10 recommend!

Pretty sure our server was Steve from Stranger Things. Regardless,  he was awesome. The meat! So much meat! Meat coming from every direction. I felt like Piper Perri.The beef rib is a must try. Everything was spectacular.  Left with a serious meat drunk. This place could convert the most devout vegan. When you're in Columbia go get your meat eat on.

Love Love Love, We have all our family celebration dinners here. The wait staff is great. The variety of meats is awesome, the cold salad bar is great. And the hot stuff they have at the bar is always good. They have a bar and have great mix drinks that they prepare at your table. As well as a variety of desserts. The wait to be seated can sometimes be long, especially if they have a promotion going on.

name: Blue Marlin
reviews: Outstanding food and atmosphere. Lively and very posh looking. Easy walking distance to hotels and other venues. The food is absolutely amazing. There is nothing in the menu that can’t be enjoyed. Recommend the Salmon Pontchartrain! Filling, tasty and very appetizing. Lo Country Shrimp and Grits is also amazing. Tasty and the grits are out of this world! Deserts are also worth a try if you have the room. They will be a sweet ending to a great night! Give this place a try if you are looking for something new tonight!

Food was good, however my wife ordered seared scallops which very too salty, but were redone without a problem, they were cooked well. She crab soup was very good.  Flounder and salad were good. Bread was a hard roll reminding me of a German bakery. No charge for coffee or soft drink. Service good and friendly

This was my first and DEFINITELY NOT THE LAST time visiting this spot. I was overwhelmed by the tastiness of this restaurant. The vibe was intimate and welcoming, as well as relaxing. The food was amazing. Flavorful and fulfilling. My only regret is not having another serving of the shrimp and grits. Hands down THE BEST shrimp and grits i've tasted ever!!!. Being a photographer, I definitely made sure I captured a few shots of my dining experience!

The food was good, not great.
However, this is take out and dining in may offer a better dining experience.
Also, I didn't order seafood so the potential for the restaurant is high. Will return to dine in when able.

This seafood place normally has rave reviews and is recommended as one of the places to visit in Columbia.  I was disappointed.  We had a fair sized group of 11.  They informed us that they could not seat 11.  They broke us up into 3 groups.  During the entire time they kept multiple tables open in the middle of the restaurant.  As we were leaving they pulled the tables together and sat a party larger than us.  The most disappointing part was that they required a gratuity for a party even though we were broke into 3 groups with separate wait staff.  The food was average at best.  I will give them credit for large amounts of food.  More than I could eat.  I had the firecracker flounder.  The sides of grits and slaw had better flavor than the fish.  The fish was bland and over fried.  It definitely needed the side of salsa for flavor.  The rest of the party at my table had similar experiences.

name: Julia's German Stammtisch
address: 120 Sparkleberry Crossing Rd, Columbia, SC 29229, USA
reviews: Everyone was extremely nice. Super flavorful.  Definitely let you try the German experience. Honestly will never forget. The owner an inspiration for the menu was present and they definitely want you to understand the culture and their flavors. I will be back. Love it

The best taste of Germany outside of Germany itself. I had the Jager schnitzel that was perfectly crispy and covered in delicious gravy. Do yourself a favor and grab dessert, if you have room, because the apple strudel is out of this world! Can't wait to come back again!

Julia's location is great, as in the decorative sense.  The feeling you get stepping past the doorway is a teleportation to Deutschland!  The Bar area is welcoming and covered with wonderful Bohemian and Bavarian beer!  Nothing to complain on that department.   Now the food... I was not impressed with the food provided at Julia's, but I blame it on the fact that I lived in Germany for 8 years. Now, if you are not familiar with the German cuisine give it a try, you will enjoy this food and all the Bier!

I lived in Germany for many yrs, so I finally decided to try Julia's for the first time. They have a new location, which is a nicer and bigger facility. Plenty of parking all around, easy to find once you come off the interstate. Its locate on the Northeast side of town in Columbia, SC.  It was recommended by a few people that I work and some locals.

They have a full bar and lots of seating inside, very welcoming place. I did a to go order and waited at the bar. They give you a free complimentary drink while you wait on your order. They were very busy the night I went. They give you huge servings that two people can share. The jager schnitzel was flat, dry, and burnt, gravy didn't have much of a flavor. The salad was good with the red beets. I really wanted to enjoy this place, maybe I will try again and have a different dish. It could be the chef was having a off day. 

I would recommend that everyone at least try once, especially if you have never had the German foodie experience. It just didn't do it for me.

We LOVED this place. My son served a church mission in Germany and loves the food so it was fun to eat the authentic stuff. One cool thing that happened while we were there is that because my son was dressed in his blues, a stranger paid for our dinner. Wow!

name: A Peace of Soul Vegan Kitchen
reviews: A Peace of Soul Vegan Kitchen is ranked in the, "Top 20 Vegan Eats Coast-to-Coast," by Food Network, and every dish I've EVER ordered there proves why! The owner, Folami, is super sweet and deserving and a true culinary visionary—I'm amazed at how she's able to transform so many southern comfort favorites into healthier, plant-based delicacies that are packed with flavor. Even my meat-eater friends love it! The newly renovated space and food truck (now on hiatus) really reflect the goodness of the food AND the people. This is HANDS-DOWN my favorite place to dine!

I'm originally from Columbia South Carolina and moved away and now I am vegan so I decided to look up vegan restaurants in my city where I'm from. I found this restaurant and was very pleased the customer service was great, the food was awesome, it was a great overall experience. When I go to visit the home now I will definitely come to visit this place for their delicious food!!!!!!

I had the "chicken" sandwich,  mac-n-"cheese" and curry potatoes. 

Let's me start by saying that I do not eat sides with my sandwiches,  let alone mac-n-cheese with it. 

Secondly,  I am a cafe, therefore my palate is very sensitive and I taste EVERYTHING when I eat. 

Everything,  I mean, absolutely everything was amazing. I have been vegan/plant based, for roughly 2 months, I lost count and I wanted to return for another order and I wasn't even 25% finished with this order. 

Congratulations on your restaurant and it's amazing success, so far. The restaurant business is no joke, let alone bringing something so uniquely different to the area.

The Mac n Cheese is really good but the bacon cheese burger was pretty disappointing, it's a huge patty but it's dry and falls apart easily, it also tastes more like sausage. The vegan bacon is disturbingly chewy, would not recommend it, but I'll definitely go back to try their other stuff tho.

The "chicken" sandwich was amazing. The macaroni and cheese is pretty good too. My first time having vegan macaroni but I would eat it again. It's a little pricey but no more so than if you went to texas roadhouse or smashburger. It's good food and well worth the money.

name: 929 Kitchen & Bar
reviews: Gorgeous restaurant in the vista, wonderful ambience and decor. Food was very good and the drinks in pouches are definitely worth a try. I believe they were some sort of speciality juice on the menu. Only caveat would be the menu selection is a little limited. I understand they would probably want to focus on doing a few dishes well, but maybe some weekly or daily specials. A little variety and this place would be the stuff of legend.

The ambiance is refreshingly cosmopolitan yet down-home.  Food is delicious and taste very authentic! You can see in the clips it’s suitable for older children.  Luv luv luv the ice cubes. Definitely a date location.

I took my wife here for her birthday this past weekend, and we were not disappointed!  The drinks were great, as well as the food!  The ambience was nice.  I wished that I was given the option for the way my egg was cooked on my bibimbap, as I would have liked it runny, but other than that, everything was amazing!

Stopped by for dinner to celebrate our anniversary. The food was delicious and the service was amazing.

Modern twist on traditional Korean dishes. My wife and I ordered two appetizers and main dishes, and shared everything. I wish we could have tried the dessert, but we were too full.

Highly recommend you visit for something tasty.

Hands down one of the best restaurants in Columbia. Even if you haven't tried Korean food you will love this place. I have been visiting Columbia for almost two weeks now and I have eaten at this restaurant at least five times if not more. The first night I ordered delivery on bitesquad. Everything came packed separate and was piping hot. Since then I've gone in for lunch and dinner trying different dishes and everything is utterly fantastic. They also have a small but well-stocked bar and plenty of beer selections as well. Don't miss this place it's a gem.

name: DiPrato's
reviews: I decided to try it for the first time. I liked it. I love how all of the beverages come in factory sealed packaging. Eliminates the issue of having flat beverages. The food was prepared quickly, yet accurately. I had the pastrami on pumpernickel. The dessert selection was pretty unique. I ordered a slice of Coconut Cake. I may return in the future.

This place was amazing. Great food, atmosphere and great service. The server told us about all kinds of different sandwiches the way she likes them. Was very informative. Tomato bisque was awesome and the cheescake was the best I have had in a while.

This place is really good! The prices are a little high but the quality of food is great. Only reason I rated them a 4 instead of 5 star is because the chicken on my husband's sandwich was very dry. Tasted a little bland but we let our server know and she apologized asking if we wanted to speak to a manager. But we just wanted her to let the kitchen know. It tasted like they precooked then cooked it again to warm it up. I was happy with my sandwich. I got the croissant breakfast sandwich, which my husband was drooling over! We will definitely be back to try something new!

Always charming & delicious! A great place to meet up for business, lunch date, girlfriend's outing, or takeout. Terrific menu selection, everything always tastes fresh, and the staff is super nice. Try and get there before noon. Lunch is usually packed. But if you can't, it's still worth the wait. Remember, they're only open for lunch.

Their pita chips are to die for.  The service was friendly and fast even during a busy time of the day.  I got their Cobb salad which was delicious.  The bacon crumbles were fresh and think.  Would come here again.

name: Lizard's Thicket Restaurant
reviews: I love Lizard Thicket's. The atmosphere of the restaurant is that of a warm and caring family, I've been coming to the restaurant for about 10 years, I came up from Florida in 2010 and what of my pastors and his family took me there for my first time, and since then, that's how I've always been treated at Lizard Thicket's. Also, food is very good, for country cooking it's really spot-on and the cleanliness of the restaurant is more than impressive. And I'll end with this the restrooms always clean. So with all that said, I will keep coming back to Lizard Thicket's for as long as I'm alive.

Always a welcoming location. Drive-thru is usually busy in the mornings, but always a table available inside. Meal is quickly made so my time inside is short. The service is quick and friendly, so that I don't have to wait a long time to eat in the morning. Love the Liver Pudding.

Great location and atmosphere. Our service was great,but the chicken sandwich was not cooked to taste. The fried chicken breast was not cooked to taste . They both were under and over cook. I didn't expect your chicken sandwich to be just a hunk of grilled  breast meat (filet) or (Pull)or a chicken tender style and it didn't come with a side. See this was our 1st time. We got our sweet tea to go which by the way was very good tea also to go boxes for our chicken that would we recook some and season it  our way at home after all it was to much chicken to be thrown away if it was prepared right.

There were lots of items to choose from on the menu. I opted for a dinner plate with a meat and two vegetables. It was delicious! My whole family enjoyed the food. The service was very good. There was a calm, quiet vibe in the restaurant and I liked that, too.

I'm from PA and I was in south Carolina couple of years ago and my family and I stopped for dinner. The food was so amazing and fresh.  I so would drive the 12 hours just for lizards Thicket. I wish they would build one here in PA..

name: Tazza Kitchen Trenholm Plaza
address: TRENHOLM PLAZA, 4840 Forest Dr #20, Columbia, SC 29206, USA
reviews: Every time someone offers up a suggestion of Tazza for brunch or dinner I emphatically say or think...."YES!". For a, smaller regional, chain they go out of their way to specialize and individualize themselves to feel like they're only a local Columbia restaurant (granted they are the only location in SC). I have honestly never had reason to complain about a single meal from any angle: food quality, drinks (great cocktails!), and service they do a wonderful job. It is tough to recommend only one or two things but I would absolutey suggest the spicy sausage and black pepper honey pizza and the cheeseburger (dijonnaise is incredible).

What a fantastic little restaurant. The ambiance is very nice and the service is great. I had the spicy Italian sausage and peppered honey pizza two days in a row... it's that tasty!  The butternut squash soup is also really good. I will definitely return next time I'm in town.

The food was fresh and had great flavor. I ordered the brisket tacos and they were delicious.  My husband and daughter ordered their own wood fired pizzas so I snuck a bite of each.  They were amazing, and the presentation was perfect.  The server was very attentive and accommodating to our requests.  I highly recommend this restaurant, and we will be returning again.

Fantastic food. Went for brunch about 10 min after they opened and place was already packed so that's a great sign. Super friendly and fast service. Had to wait over 30 min for food but it's so worth it because you can for sure taste how fresh everything is. Drinks not the greatest but the food makes up for it. Prices are a little high but you get what you pay for. Cant wait to go back!

Great service, atmosphere, and cocktails. However, the food left much to be desired. Ordered the cast iron goat cheese (amazing!), a pizza, and my significant other ordered a pasta dish (can’t remember exactly what it was). Overall, the food was just okay. The pizza was a bit burnt, which I normally don’t mind, but it was lacking flavor which exacerbated the taste of the burnt crust. The pasta was just okay, did not taste authentic or of restaurant quality. I would definitely like to give Tazza another try since everyone I know absolutely raves about this place, but maybe try some other items on the menu.

name: Solstice Kitchen & Wine Bar
reviews: A lovely diner evening, and enjoyable experience. Great, well balanced menu from which I would highly recommend The brussels sprouts as a starter. For a main I had The bronzed Atlantic Salmon which was delicious. The service was fantastic. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu, very attentive to our table, and very friendly. Interior of the dinning area is very well laid out and makes for a very welcoming environment. Would love to eat here again.

Service was great and everything we ate was amazing! Highly recommend the fried oysters! The food was SO good! The restaurant itself is a little small, so you don't get a ton of privacy, but it made for a wonderful dinner for my wife and I. We will definitely be returning! Keep up the great work guys! 👍
Great place for a dinner for two. The service is fast and friendly. The food was exactly as ordered. It has a nice sized bar with a large selection of drinks. Definitely will be back.

The meal was excellent, I mean absolutely delicious. The price was reasonable for the quality, 25-50 per person (50 with adult beverages and desert). The average age of the crowd was 40-60. Definitely not the place for kids or a cheap date. Fabulous for a small group of up-classed adults or intimate dinner. Dress ranges from very nice to relaxed but not too relaxed.
A gem of a restaurant in Columbia. You need reservations here. The food is local and delicious and changes with the seasons. Great ambiance, great service, fantastic cocktails and wine list.

name: Jason's Deli
reviews: My first time in a Jason's Deli.  I knew I wanted a salad so a quick search for that and Jason's popped up.  Thank you Will for showing me what you have to offer, where to go to order and for being over all helpful and nice.  The salad bar is great, everything is fresh and crisp! I also had the Irish potato soup, wow! I wish we had a Jason's Deli in Orangeburg!!!

My brother and his wife had bragged on the Jason's Deli in Athens, GA for a while, so when we met up in Columbia, SC, they recommended lunch there. My only problem was finding parking close enough for my feeble self to be able to walk in with my walker rather than have to have help with a wheelchair. But with it's downtown location, mostly metered parking and my lack of knowledge of the area, I think we managed fairly well. Upon walking in we were greeted by genuinely very friendly staff members. They explained the menu, made some recommendations, and I still wanted to try everything. So many sandwiches, baked potatoes, soups and combos to shower from! Although I had planned on the wonderful salad bar I had heard so much about, I went with half a grilled veggie sandwich, fruit, and cup of seasonal lobster chowder (so good). My mom chose a half club sandwich with chips and a cup of broccoli cheese soup. They had so many good soups on the menu it was difficult to choose one. I'm still thinking about the descriptions of the Irish potato soup and the chicken chili and wishing I could get back there to try them. By the way, complimentary soft serve ice cream is included with the salad bar. How cool is that? Their pastry/dessert selection looked amazing, but we didn't splurge at the time. Great lunch spot, I highly recommend giving them a try.

Under new management. Really appreciate the new manager taking the time to come face to face with the customers to make a better name for this location. Some of the food on the salad bar needed to be refilled, but we were there during the lunch hour. The cashier was not the friendliest and seemed like she wasn’t thrilled to be at work. Will definitely come back again as Jason’s is one of our go to spots.
Large deli with fresh food. Dine in or carry out makes it very convenient. Good food, large portions, and low prices.
Best lunch in town with a trip to the very fresh salad bar and sandwich  (I got it without bread).  Less than  $8.  And you get dessert!

name: Thirsty Fellow Pizzeria and Pub
reviews: Stop at Thirsty Fellows before all the home SC women’s basketball games. Staff is attentive & food is awesome. If Jessica is working, she’s a fabulous waitress. The cold adult beverages hit the spot. Great atmosphere. Recommend highly for good grub & a good time.

Nice casual dining within walking distance of the Carolina Coliseum and the Colonial Life Arena.  Food was great.  I was skeptical of the lemon vinegarette dressing but it was surprisingly delicious.  I'm not a huge lemon fan but this dressing is a must try.  I can't remember what my husband are (pictured) but he loved it.  The inside is decorated with walls full of books.  Gives you sense that you're in a library. Bathrooms were clean.  Outside area with high top tables for sitting around and watching the games with friends.
TRASH. Im so embarrassed to say that I helped open this place many years ago. It takes an act of extreme ignorance or neglect for a pizza to turn into soup. Thanks for wasting our lunch

From service to atmosphere to food,  this charming establishment gets all high marks . I visited Columbia, with my dog, to take my college student to lunch. She suggested Thirsty Fellow, based on a prior visit and that they are dog friendly.  The outdoor seating area was covered,  super clean and had heaters. It was a windy, chilly day so that was a plus! The server was attentive and the burgers we ordered were BIG!  I have paid more for much less filling lunches.  This was definitely a great dining experience that we want to repeat.

Went for lunch and had several of their special items. Food was good but service was lacking and the food took along time to come out. We did have a table of 8 people so I'm sure that contributed but still they weren't packed and the food wasn't anything that should have taken 30 min to prepare. Overall experience was good. We enjoyed our meal and I would go back.

name: Backstreets Grill
reviews: We got take out lunch today and the online order was easy! The food was done in the by the estimated time. We got the Cuban with Coleslaw, the Crab & Artichoke dip w/ pita, the Asian Salad w/ Salmon, Med-Hot Wings, & the Quesadilla w/ chicken. All of the food was very flavorful. The portions are a good size. The building was easy to find and the interior decor was very modern, clean and stylish. I can't wait to go back and eat inside! PS - They enclosed a hand written note in the Togo order thanking us for supporting local business! Very nice touch!

Nice atmosphere - more of a bar. Would be good on game day to watch your favorite team. Wings were not great (Public House still has best ones). Will try burger next time - it is the litmus test for Columbia ;)

Very good food, excellent service, good drinks. Nice varied menu. I had the Reuben and potato cake. Karen had the Southwest club and truffle fries (they're a little extra, but consider them) They were very accommodating in substituting the pepper jack (a little too much, we thought, with the spicy sauce). The Reuben was perfect, including a perfect crust on the bread and good balance -- not overwhelmed with kraut or thousand island. Loved the tomato parmesan soup, and Karen said it was some of the best French onion she's had. I wasn't overwhelmed by salt the way too many are and had a generous cheese crust. The potato cake was a little under seasoned, but just needed a quick shake of table salt. Backstreets is in the old Dianne's on Devine. We'll be back when we're in the neighborhood.
Awesome Reuben and loved the sweet potatoes also. Great lunch and service was excellent.

Looking forward to coming back here. A friend and I decided to give this a try and we were not disappointed! My friend had a salad with grilled chicken, mandarin oranges’ and I am not sure what else. She ate it all! It was very popular that day. I got their Cuban sandwich. I’ve never tried one before and it did not disappoint. I loved it! They’ve got a great selection of tap beer also. Not sure common run-of-the-mill Budweiser or Miller light either. I had a Sierra Nevada But I can’t tell you which one. It was perfect with the sandwich.

name: Cantina 76
reviews: Love this place. They always have new specialty tacos when I'm there, that are just as amazing as their regularly served tacos. Everything on the menu is delicious. Staff is always very friendly and helpful. Food always comes out quickly and fresh. Definitely give this place a try if you're in the area looking for a great place to eat. Especially if you want Mexican style food but not from a traditional Mexican restaurant!
Nice quick little place. Had a wonderful meal.  The was cooked just right and the restaurant was extremely interesting and fun to look around at.

The food was great and it's obvious everything is fresh and made in house. The margaritas were excellent. We brought our kids, but it was apparent quickly that this isn't really a "family" restaurant. While there wasn't a kids menu, they were still very accommodating when we ordered for them. The tacos were good, but if you're expecting authentic Mexican, I would look elsewhere.
My daughter took me here for a late lunch. Nice atmosphere and good food. The staff was very professional and courteous. Can't wait to go back!

Busy but worth the wait.  We went for lunch on a Monday and it was crowded with downtown workers but the wait wasn't too long and service was quick, Tori was friendly and efficient.  The fried chicken taco salad was one of the best I have had.  Husband had the chimichanga and loved it.  Fresh salsa and chips were tasty too.

name: Motor Supply Company Bistro
reviews: Great atmosphere, good location, amazing servers, delicious food! Our server was Shelby, she has a wonderful and uplifting personality! She put our experience here over the top! My wife had the Salmon Salad, I had the Patty melt, we were both very pleased. We will definitely be dining here again!

Our first time dining here.  Why did I wait so long?!  Food is fabulous.   Even my husband was impressed, and he doesn't care for "fancy" food.  A bit pricey, but I promise, you get what you pay for.  I will be back.

We stopped in randomly for a bite to eat and all I can say is WOW! Incredible service, delectable food, and well made drinks. Serving sizes were great and the overall ambiance was great. Next time I'm in Columbia this will be at the top of my list

I thought the service was some of the best I have ever had in a restaurant. I also thought the ginger ice cream sandwich was amazing! I however was not impressed with my steak. It seasoned well and cooked well but was very  tough. I really expected better quality meat for what we paid. I would come back for sure and give them another shot.

Pricey but worth every penny!
Service was prompt and very knowledgeable on menu items.
I like the complimentary valet and the ambience of the place was very rustic yet elegant.
Great spot for a fancy lunch. Highly recommended.

name: Al's Upstairs Italian Restaurant
address: 300 Meeting St, West Columbia, SC 29169, USA
reviews: I've lived in Columbia, SC for nearly 12 years and by some cruel twist I had never visited this landmark restaurant until 2019. What a remarkable experience. Beautiful view of the Columbia skyline and river. Soft atmosphere. Impeccable service......all this was just the beginning. The menu is diverse and resplendent. The wine selection is deep and supportive of the exceptional menu. Portions are generous and flavorful with absolutely perfect ingredients. Every phase of this experience was satisfying and rewarding. Highly recommend! 5 Giant stars!

Loved it. Great view of Columbia sky line. Service was excellent. The food was great! From the meat balls to the sauce, the chicken park, kabobs to the dessert. Will definitely go back. Was disappointed only because they had run out of eggplant. 😟 I love eggplant. Maybe next time.

Amazing romantic setting! It’s upstairs (hence the name) and offers a great view of Downtown Columbia! We had the fried oysters and crab cakes for an appetizer and they were top notch. The service was exceptional and the server was attentive without being intrusive. It is definitely an adult only restaurant. The price was appropriate for the food and setting offered.

Al’s Upstairs is by far one of favorite restaurants in Downtown Columbia. Our host/hostess is always highly professional and courteous. And the food? The food is always amazing. Our favorite are the crab cakes appetizer followed by the Pasta Alla Al entrée. Try to request a window seat while making your reservation to take advantage of the Downtown Columbia city views.

Our son was graduating from USC School of Pharmacy and wanted to go to Al's Upstairs for his celebration dinner. When we called to make a reservation, they were already booked. After talking to Al and explaining how much our son liked the restaurant, he was able to accommodate our party of 3. We had a wonderful dinner. The food was great; Pasta a la Al - amazing, Veal chop - perfect, Chicken Charleston - great. They had our favorite Italian wine, Amarone. The service was also outstanding. I wish I could give them 6 stars.

name: Terra Restaurant
address: 100 State St, West Columbia, SC 29169, USA
reviews: Lovely ambience with this spot, great for a date night dinner or a casual lunch. Outdoor seating looks lovely, it was winter when we went. Additionally the pizza menu is quite diverse and the two we had were dynamite. Definitely recommend and will be going back soon!!!!

Food delicious and fresh. I had steak that came with fries and small salad. Only a few entrees to choose from and I think the chef changes them sometimes from day to day. Husband had flounder which was in a sauce and he said it was delicious but for all entrees on the day we went you had to order sides additionally except for the steak. We had a macaroni and lamb appetizer dish which was very very good. Desserts wonderful. The ambience is nice and a big beautiful bar area. Terra is located in a very old (about 100 years?) Building in a row of original buildings in West Columbia and feels like an "extension" of the Columbia Vista. Highly recommend Terra but, ok it's pricey but it's worth it. Lovely courtyard area available for private parties.

This was by far one of the best pizzas I've ever had in South Carolina. Definitely worth 20 $5 or more. I will be returning. Looking forward to the next time they have mahi-mahi on the menu. I highly suggest trying this restaurant if you have never been and if you have the bankroll to do it. No scum or bums allowed.

Always an exceptional meal! Tonight we were planning to get the grilled pork chop, but it wasn't on the menu. We were not disappointed though, as we had the swordfish, and we were very happy with it. And delicious profiteroles for dessert.
I was blown away by my experience at this restaurant.  Presentation and flavor of our food was exquisite! If your looking for a fine dining experience,  this is a great place

name: Mr. Friendly's New Southern Cafe
address: 2001 Greene St A, Columbia, SC 29205, USA
reviews: Decided to try Mr. Friendly's this evening looking for good southern cuisine.  Believe all of the great reviews about the food, it's authentic, exceptionally prepared and served in phenomenal quantity.  The wine list, beer selections and, cocktails are varied, eclectic and a little unique. Finding a wine pairing for your meal won't be a problem!  The staff are engaging, attentive and professional without being hard to talk with.  Questions about the menu didn't require a trip to the kitchen as our waitress knew menu and made great suggestions.
very small restaurant with a good seasonal menu. our server was pleasant. large wine menu! I wasnt a fan of my entree but everything else including my dates dinner was tasty!

Busy on a Monday for lunch was a great first impression! Really cool little spot in Columbia featuring comfort food of The South. Great menu selection with beer wine and cocktails and friendly and prompt service. I will definitely return when I'm back in the city.

Food was great,  except for the grilled green tomatoes.  They were too salty. The portion sizes were small for the cost of the food.  The waitress was pleasant and friendly. Nice ambiance and beautiful artwork.
Awesome restaurant! Service was exceptional, presentation was on point, food was delicious! We stopped here cause they buy local and it didn't disappoint. Would highly recommend this establishment.

name: The Melting Pot
address: 1410 Colonial Life Blvd W Ste 130, Columbia, SC 29210, USA
reviews:
Me and my boyfriend visited this location the day after Valentine’s Day for a belated celebration. This place is amazing!! So comfortable, romantic, fun experience. The food was so good and the drinks were fantastic. The only reason for 3 stars is our waiter was run ragged. He explained how they were short staffed that night and to bare with him which is completely understandable. Every single time he came to our table he was sweating and out of breath, obviously stressed.

Our reservation was at 9:30, we were sat by 9:40. We didn’t leave till 12:40. Which we didn’t notice since we were on a much needed date and our waiter even gave us a free bottle of wine for the inconvenience. He was so informative and helpful. But please, hire more people or you will for sure lose the good quality ones!!!

This is the best place to take out a date or to take spouse out for a dinning experience sure to impress,  the table/booths are very private and intimate you wont have to worry about the people at other tables staring at you while you dine. Be ready to sit and enjoy dinner for at least 2 or more hours because you will be cooking most of your food at table in different cooking styles from grilling to a boiling hot broth dip , the food is of the highest quality

Very nice restaurant, a welcomed change from the norm. The restaurant itself was nice and our server, John, was absolutely amazing! He was passionate about his job it it showed! The prices were a little higher than expected, but I would definitely recommend that you give this place a try at least once!
That place it's always fun to eat at. It is a pricey but delicious. Make sure you bring your appetite with you!!! Jason was a very attentive server and did a great job!
I absolutely love The Melting Pot with my entire heart! An amazing and intimate atmosphere. We had a great waitress! Can't remember her name but she had green hair and was so down to earth and kind.

name: Kimchi Korean Restaurant
reviews: It was a delightful experience! I ate my entire meal and with chop sticks for the first time in my life ( successfully! 🥰.  The attendant was very hospitable and professional / attentive. Everything ( the entrees and appetizers) were great. I now know to ask for fried rice with my meal although the steamed rice was superb. The food was authentic per my son who served in S. Korea and was more of an expert in the cuisine than I. 🙂 Looking forward to returning. 👍🏿👍🏿❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Service was great.  I was the one who took a while ordering.  I got the kalbitang (beef stew)  and it was so good and the meat was very tender.  Would come back again.

I like to go with friends to this restaurant with my warmest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the stuff is generous and cooperative. always when we visit this place we pass a splendid time.  highly recommended.

I like to go with friends to this place with my highest recommendations. I visit this restaurant often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is appetizing and the stuff is very friendly and cooperative. Whenever we go to this place we have a pleasant evening.  I recommend this place with pleasure.

Delish! If you are looking for excellent, authentic Korean food.... This is the place to visit! The lunch specials were great and there were even "box" options - which offer a little more variety then the specials. I had a tasty Kimchi Soup and we splurged and bought a "Korean Pancake." Sides were wonderful, as usual. Highly recommend making the trip!

name: Asanka Kitchen
address: 10203 Two Notch Rd, Columbia, SC 29229, USA
reviews: Elizabeth was just wonderful! She gave us a "taste tour" of the dishes and explained West African cuisine. We had the jollof rice and tomato stew with mackerel, the red pepper soup with goat meat, the spicy Mac and cheese and the fried plantains. Everything was delicious! Elizabeth is so welcoming and treats all her guests like family, we can't wait to come back!

This is an amazing place! I was met with love from day one and everytime I come back they make me feel like family! Food is amazing! They give you great portion sizes and there is something for everyone here!

It was our first time eating West African cuisine and we absolutely enjoyed it. It is an excellent establishment with very courteous service, good vibe music and an overall great experience with their "Ritual" of food tasting. Wish we weren't leaving the area soon, so we can frequent this hidden gem more often!

Jollof rice, red red, and plantains were my staple meal the summer I studied abroad in Ghana. So happy to discover I can dine on this meal at home! The food was hot and delicious and everything I hoped it would be. Can't wait to get it again!!

It's safe to say that Columbia is full of hidden treasure that could not be discovered unless someone else told you about it. Asanka Kitchen is at the top of that list and will continue to grow in popularity due to its delicious food and wonder customer service. Very welcoming friendly atmosphere filled with generous portions of food, served with a smile. I will be returning.

name: Ristorante Divino
reviews: Duck was delicious. Bread and stuffed peppers were also. Excellent

Ristorante Divino is expensive Italian restaurant downtown.  The main dishes hit well and they have a extra helping of flavor. The scallops were seared perfectly and the risotto had a unique and interesting flavor. The pappardelle was flavorful and smooth and the sauce was well matched for a wide pasta.  The appetizers were also good especially the calamari, which I would claim was the best I've had in Columbia.  However, Divino faulters as a fine dining experience in Columbia in part due to it's outdated decor, its inexperienced staff, and a dessert, which was honestly . . . terrible.  The tiramisu was dry, lacked flavor, and should just be taken off the menu.  After quite a good meal putting that on the table left us quite literally with a bad taste in our mouth as we walked out the door.
Very nice!  Great service and food.  Warm, cozy atmosphere.
Very tasty authentic Italian dishes. Cozy atmosphere, very friendly and attentive service.

The dining experience here was amazing. As soon as you walked in the atmosphere changed. All employees were dressed formally and spoke to you with respect.

The service was average, except for the waitress who treated my mother poorly because she ordered a soup and a salad instead of something expensive.

I had the Paparadelle Bolognese. It was outstanding. The seasoning was just the right amount and I wasn't overloaded with the potatoes. I certainly received what I paid for.

name: Top of Carolina Restaurant
reviews: Tried far in advance to make a reservation for parents weekend but was booked. Due to a cancellation we get in! I'm from Chicago and have been to a few brunch and must say this place was Awesome. Better than a few places I've been to. The food was excellent, the staff were friendly , polite and helpful. The view was beautiful. Took a bit to get use to the revolving . I will be back!!!! Best brunch and priced reasonable. Thank you for a great experience . Students can use a meal plan here just need to pay the difference.

Food was AMAZING!!!! EVERYTHING I ate was delicious!!! The view was fabulous!! Wait staff were friendly and those who are preparing your food were friendly and helpful!  Great experience and I can't wait to go back

The view is nice. Unfortunately, the food is sub par. Food was lukewarm. Salmon was fishy a d the pasta was too salty. The salad with the orange vinaigrette was great. My wife was eating off of the "vegan" menu, but they brought her a salad covered in goat cheese that we had to send back, then on desert they brought her chocolate covered strawberries and a pound cake with cream that we also had to send back. I was "aware" of the price, because I called in and asked, but I was told $80, I overheard someone else in the restaurant be told $70, the bill came out at $77 but was not itemized. I'm not sure if that was $70 plus tax or $70 flat including tax and they up-sold me on the sparkling cider. At this point, I was just irritated, and I was ready to go.

It’s been a long time since we’ve visited Top of Carolina and our first visit for their BBQ Friday lunch. We went the Friday before Easter for an “experience” with our 14 year old granddaughter. It exceeded all expectations. Other than finding a place to park, our lunch was perfect. There was a big selection of food; bbq, fried chicken, fish, salads, vegetables, deserts and ice tea, lemonade and coffee were included. It takes about an hour for a full rotation and we enjoyed the changing scenery. One of my favorite things is it’s casual....jeans, shorts and even baby strollers were there. For the price you can’t go wrong and our granddaughter had a meal she will remember for a long time. The servers couldn’t have been nicer and went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed,
Great atmosphere and food. Vincent is especially kind and friendly and makes an incredible custom omelette! Can't wait to go back.

name: The Whig
reviews: The food is incredible! Wish the Veg-Fil-A was an everyday menu item because OH MY GOD IS IT GOOD... But I'll be happy to have the smoked Gouda Mac n cheese! The place is darkly lit but really good stop for dinner and a drink or 2. My only regret is that it's not open for lunch!
Good beer. Good atmosphere. Definitely could be a cramped spot, but we were also able to sit down at a table on a Saturday night. Worth a look if you like the bar scene.
This place is the fire. Great dive bar with awesome food. Huge selection of draft and canned beer. Bar tenders were knowledgeable and friendly. Highly recommend. No TVs.
Great place to grab a drink. Solid variety and cool atmosphere. Food is pretty good too. Smaller inside so can feel full easily. Definitely worth checking out
It's a hole in the wall dive bar that seems to be popular. I went on Tuesday Taco Night and there was a crowd but not overly crowded. It was easy to move around but seating was limited at times.

name: 1801 Grille
reviews: I really enjoyed my visit. We were seated promptly at our reservation time and everyone enjoyed their food. The only downside is that a lot of the staff are college students and they just don't have great customer service. Our server, Tyler was great. He offered great recommendations and made sure we never wanted for anything. I'll definitely return!

This is my favorite sandwich right now..
 it is  fatty brisket with brie cheese ....
some kind of yummy mayonnaise sauce,roasted tomatoes and caramelized onions... it is one of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten in my life.....

Really fun place with great service. Definitely has an upscale grill feel to it so you can dress up nice or not. The appetizer portions are small but the food servings are substantial. The only downside is finding parking but they can't do anything about that. Salmon was fantastic but has a lot of pepper. Strawberry salad was great too!

We chose 1801 Grill for a rehearsal dinner party Friday, Jan 17.  Our contact, Sara Allen, was extraordinarily helpful and had great suggestions on setup, menu, and best use of the available space. We hosted 57 people in the party room and had the bar for happy hour and buffet.  The space was cozy but comfortable.  Chef Bruner's appetizers, buffet and desert totally exceeded our expectations.  Buffets tend to dry out; not ours--everything was hot, fresh and tender. They supported us with a huge staff of cheerful, enthusiastic servers; I think some were students of the USC School of Hospitality. They get top marks.  All-in--all, this was the best choice we could have made.  Sorry, I ran out of stars, this place is the best.

Gouda cheese bites were a great way to start.
Ribs were tender, fall off the bone.
Burger was cooked to perfection, and the bacon was flavorful and crispy.
All things considered, while the food was good it was not excellent, and the portion was far from the price point. 

Service was attentive and professional, though it was a slow night.

name: Eggs Up Grill
reviews: We decided to do our Father’s Day breakfast here this year and we were not disappointed. The food came out fresh and fast. All of our party enjoyed the taste of everything. Service was fantastic for our party of 17. Our servers were very professional and patient with our children. Thank you to Stephanie and Rachel for the awesome job they did with our family! In watching the service around us, service was fantastic for parties of any side. I highly recommend the Sweet Potato waffles, the Southern Style Omelet, and the coffee. We will be back when we visit Columbia again.

Wait staff was great, helpful, and friendly. Food was prepared quickly and tasted great. We had a large group and she did wonderful with our orders! I had no complaints and would definitely return again!

Eggs Up on Devine Street is my go-to breakfast spot. Always delicious food and fast, friendly service! I highly recommend them for a meal or even catering. The egg white omelet is my favorite, but I haven't had anything I haven't liked there. I'm excited to go back!

My daughter and I chose Eggs Up for breakfast and the food was wonderful! The pancakes were delicious and her bacon, egg, and cheese melt was great. Our server was also wonderful, even though the restaurants was busy. The food came out fast and the manager came over to check on us. A+ service!

A must visit while in the area. From the staff to the ambiance- this place was amazing. Our server was playful, reasonable prices, no long wait times and this place was packed. Will definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants a delicious breakfast while in town. Bravo!

name: Travinia Italian Kitchen & Wine Bar
address: 101 Sparkleberry Crossing Rd, Columbia, SC 29229, USA
reviews:
The Staff, Management and FOOD is Amazing. I have been to many restaurants but Travinia in NE Columbia is by far the best dining out experience I have had in a very long time. My server was Meagan and she was a great help with me deciding what to order. She took such good care of me! 
I can't say enough about the food and Staff...they really work hard to make sure you are pleased with Everything!!
and I can't wait to go back!
I give it 10 Thumbs Up!!!!

We stopped in around 4:30 p.m. because the nearby restaurant and bar wasn’t open until 5 p.m. and were pleasantly surprised to find a lively bar crowd enjoying bowl games and post-holiday drinks. The single server/bartender was busy but pleasant and generously offered samples of the red wines I asked about before I committed to a glass. We shared the small antipasto ($12) and it was perfect for the small snack we wanted with our drinks. They even accommodated out request to leave off the roasted tomatoes and add more buratta - grazie!

OUT OF THIS WORLD ITALIAN FOOD 
I had Chicken Parmesan. The linguine was AMAZING, so soft and fresh. The chicken was crispy and the sauce was definitely homemade. BEST meal I have had in months!  I would give this place 10 stars. The price was not bad at all for the quality. The ambiance was superb, the place was packed, but not so loud we had to talk over. The wait was a little long, make a reservation on Fri or Sat. Tons of wine in all price ranges. Excellent service. The total package.

Entree, dessert, and atmosphere was all amazing. Our waitress, Ansley, was incredible and had sensational recommendations. We will definitely be returning. The only thing that saddens me about our experience was the table next to us. There was about 5 children who left a huge mess under the table. Their mother also was vocally complaining about her entree. I noticed we had gotten the same dish, the “Pan Roasted Chicken,” and she was loudly complaining to the manager that there was “Too much bacon.” Very unprofessional. The dish was amazing and included in the description it included bacon. I loved it and my husband did as well. We will be back soon!

Popular Italian eatery in a convenient location.  Food, service and atmosphere were above par.  Hope was our server and couldn't have been more helpful.  It was our first time here, and she helped with our menu selections.  
Hubby had the Bolognese and enjoyed it very much.
I had the Veal Marsala and it was divine.  For a nominal charge, they allowed me to substitute a side for the pasta, which I was happy about.
Tiramisu was our dessert choice and yummy - so large it is a must to share!
Kitchen has an open view so you can see the busy staff preparing the dishes.  
We definitely enjoyed our dining experience here and would return when we are in the Columbia area.

name: Villa Tronco Italian Restaurant
reviews: Excellent Italian cuisine and fine service. I enjoyed the sirloin steak with goat cheese. It was perfect. Topped it off with a cappuccino and tiramisu.

The meal was excellent from start to finish. They have really improved this restaurant in the past few years and brought it to its original glory. Then wine selection was not huge but it was outstanding. The veal and the seafood dishes were delicious and so was the cheesecake as always. The service was patient and thoughtful. I would definitely return and recommend it.

The service was friendly and extremely prompt! 👍 The meat balls were flavorful. I am not a fan of the sauce. It doesn't have much flavor. I didn't see any typical Italian seasonings in it. Some people like their tomato sauce that way. I won't knock it for that. Just not my thing. It is kind of like bbq, some people like Texas style some like Memphis style. To each there own. I gave 3 stars because our food was cold

Been here several other times, this time was for my birthday. Place is clean, the food is great, actually it's phenomenal. The staff is always friendly. It's kind of expensive but amazing for special occasions.
Eggplant parmigiana as good as from NY.  Excellent service.  Dinner comes with salad and bread.    4 stars only because the portion was a little  small.

name: Inakaya Japanese Restaurant
reviews: We went for my husband's 30th birthday and we had a blast! The waitress was amazing even though the place was super busy. The sushi was fresh and really good. The only problem was that the steak I got was flooded with soy sauce so it made it a little salty. Other than that would definitely recommend to anyone!
My fiancé is a connoisseur (I’m more of an endless pit) but we both love this place. When we call in their people are always very helpful, patient and informed. 100% recommend checking them out!

A+ for service and for variety and it sounds like their rolls are great. I have to give 3 stars because the quality of fish for sushi and sashimi was a little lacking. Stringy and tough is not what you want. Very nice environment and all the other cooked dishes we had were excellent.
The taste of each sushi roll was as expected:  Great!  The only feedback is to focus on the structural integrity of the rolls.  They fell apart very easy.

If you love Fresh Sushi, then this the place for you. They have an assortment of Sushi, Sashimi and various cooked foods on their menu. IF you don't see it on the menu, ASK for it. They can are happy to make anything you ask for. In my decades of experience eating here - Any roll or Japanese food eaten at any other restaurant, they are happy to make for me at my request. Cost-wise, they are comparable to prices paid elsewhere. However, Freshness is their selling point.

The clientele is mostly ex-military, military and an abundance of locals who love Sushi! They open at 5pm for dinner but get crowded early on but leave within 45 minutes. For best seating arrive at opening or well after 6:30pm.

Oh, they are open for lunch and frequently have Lunch specials - be sure to ask about them!

name: Publico
reviews: Awesome spot in Five Points! The atmosphere is so comfortable. You will see everyone from business, families to couples. Drinks were delicious and food was flavorful. Lots of options!
I liked the lunch better than brunch. The drink menu is good. Tacos are decent. THE JOY IS IN THE PIMENTO BITES YALL

You can not go wrong with anything you order from here. Everything is delicious and they are accommodating with anything you want to change. I ordered the nachos and everything was so fresh, even the queso was homemade and delicious on it. There is also buy one get one free drinks at brunch! I loved this place so much I went back the next weekend.

This is a must stop place. We sat at the dog friendly patio. The food is absolutely delicious and the dog menu is especially nice. The service was great and prices were very affordable. I would definitely recommend and will be returning.
Really relaxing on Sunday Brunch. Good choice of beer / drink and great food. Very good service

name: Il Giorgione
reviews: This place has great food and I have been many times.  However, I don’t plan on going back after my last experience.  A group of friends had a table for 8 with a 5:30 reservation.  Some of the group trickled in closer to 6PM but someone arrived at the restaurant at 5:30 to claim the reservation.  Obviously with a larger group it takes more time for the entire dining experience than it would for a table for 2 or 4 people.  After 2 hours Monica, the owner, came over to our table and basically told us we needed to go to the bar or leave because she had the table reserved for someone else.  While I consider myself to be an understanding person, the way she handled it and her attitude was a complete turn off.  She wasn’t very pleasant and made us feel like we had to rush to finish our half full glasses of wine after ordering a bottle of wine.  She was not friendly or seemed appreciative of the business we had done at her restaurant.  George, her husband/co-owner, came over after she did and told us thank you and asked if we enjoyed the meal...how customer service should be!  With understanding this being a smaller space, it was never mentioned that there was a time limit when the reservation was made via the telephone.  In fact, my friend originally tried to make a reservation for 10 and Monica said we can’t accommodate 10 people in a short tone.  My friend’s response was “Well, I guess we won’t be eating at your restaurant will we?”.   I am extremely disappointed as there is no other place like iL Giorgione in Columbia.  Too bad...

One of our favorite places to go for authentic Italian food!! They make their own mozzarella in house and it is amazing!! Love, love their Spaghetti Carbonara as it's as close to authentic that I've found!
Great service, awesome drink menu, really tasty food, and good prices....they have it all. I'll definitely be back.
Staff, atmosphere, and food were amazing! Can"t wait to go back.

I arrive at this unique restaurant often since I like the ambiance that is characterizes this restaurant. The staff is exceptionally friendly and professional. The service is exceptionally efficient. Needless to say, the food you eat is excellent. I ate there more than once and I was always happy. The expense is decent. I suggest this place to all my friends.

name: Cantina 76
reviews: I can definitely say this place has a great/fun atmosphere, just my opinion on this but the tacos are just weird, BBQ tacos? I mean come on.... that’s like something you create in your kitchen when you’re hammered, on a positive note the guacamole is exceptional. I highly recommend ordering that! Another note the bartenders are great! As a former bartender myself I can certainly say that these guys know how to make drinks! Very good guys!👍🏻
Awesome fresh food and fast service!
The spot is extraordinary and roomy, the food was delightful and the rates were very affordable. rapidly, efficient service and very personal waiters. Recommended.
Great Tex- Mex food and mixologist Christina served my perfectly mixed Margaritas with a smile! Thank you!

On Cinco de Mayo my wife and I decided to go to go here to get take out. We come here regularly and usually have had decent experiences. We waited in line for 20 minutes to order and then another hour for food, which was as to be expected due to covid and the Cinco de Mayo crowd. 

My wife and I ordered 8 tacos. The girl taking our order wrote it all down correctly, read back to me what I read to her. She placed the order and brought me back a non-itemized receipt, which made sense cost-wise. 

When they brought the food to us, they read our order to me which was missing 2 tacos. We told them that we were missing those tacos, and a girl went to check on it for us. Five minutes later, a different employee came out with a $7.70 bill saying if we wanted them that we would have to pay. I told him that I already ordered the tacos and paid, but that my tacos simply weren’t in the bag. He went back to check on them for me. The employee then returned another five minutes later with the original receipt which was all balled up, like it was in the trash, and he went through the bill with me to prove that they were right and that I owed them the money for the tacos. 

I begrudgingly paid the extra, and he then placed the order for me, which came out 15 minutes after that point (which was 25 minutes after the original bag of food we already waited an hour for). By this time our original tacos were cold. 

In addition, when we went in the car to eat the tacos, some of the tacos had cheese on them, which we ordered them without cheese due to my wife’s dairy allergy. 

The poor customer service that I received yesterday is why I will never return to Cantina 76 and I will stop recommending it to colleagues and friends. I hope it was worth the $7.70.

name: Pawleys Front Porch
reviews: Very good burger. Fresh and large patty. We enjoyed the chili cheese fries as an appetizer but the sweet potato fries were fabulous. True sweet tea. The only slight was the delay but server was very pleasant. We ate on the porch and was able to bring our fur baby with us.

We found out about this place from our tour guide at USC. He mentioned it was featured on Dives, Diners, and Drive Ins, so we knew we had to check it out. Honestly, I thought it was a liquor store at first because of all of the decorations in the window, but as we walked to the door, we realized it wasn't. The inside was fun and the waitress was extremely friendly with quick service. They're known for their burgers, so some of us tried to that and they were HUGE. They were absolutely delicious and well worth the money!

Good main dishes, but the service... I know it was busy when we came in but it tapered off long before we left. Never got drink refills, finally got our extra side of honey mustard as we left (which we ordered with our meal,) and spent 2/3 of our time in the restaurant AFTER finishing eating. This was our second time coming and second time with sluggish service. Our server was super nice, just... very slow. Happy to say the fries were excellent this time. Highly recommend the pimento cheese and fried green tomato BLT- it was off the charts! Giving 3☆ instead of 4 because I feel like service is hit or miss... and we just keep missing it.
These burgers and fries were absolutely phenomenal! Service was great as well. I will be back soon to try more items on the menu. In my photo is the Wadmalaw burger on a pretzel bun

Best Sweet Potato Fries EVER ! Burger was good,  the Fried Green Tomato BLT was excellent,  what a concept to add Fried Green Tomato and Pimento Cheese.  Completely different than other sandwiches.  Wife loved her buttermilk chicken wrap also. We ate there at lunch so it wasn't busy yet. We had great service and quick,  hot food.

name: Henry's Restaurant & Bar
reviews: Great burgers and fries - Greek salad was surprisingly excellent. Usually good burger places don't have good salad but this place beats their competitors nearby on this item. Furniture is basic but good and beer selection are very good.

We were looking for a bite to eat for lunch when we happened upon this place.  Our server was Hilary, and she was so nice!  She sat us at the table our 4 year old chose, and was quick to get us beverages.  She was readily available when we needed to order our food.  The kids menu was perfect, and I was able to get a favorite, fried pickles!  I got a burger called the "Mess".  It was a burger patty with a fried egg, and chili.  Nomnom.  The kiddo got a corn dog and fries with a lemonade.  They had a large menu, and lots of beer choices.  The room was large for plenty of seats, and they had an outside patio as well.  I will return to this establishment again soon!

They have the vittles! Outstanding brunch and beverages. My first time there, while visiting my pops for an early Father's Day weekend. Since it was my first time at the bar restaurant, I had to order the "Chonga"--stellar breakfast burrito with eggs and various meats, with a side of fruit and hashbrown casserole. I took half to go. Our server-bar tender, Alyssa, was outstanding--very professional (giving great recommendations) and friendly. You could tell she has experience working there--kind of runs that place but not in an overbearing style. Probably is fun to work for/with. Regarding the stellar food, apparently the head chef (Henry?) gets there at 5 AM to make the magic happen. Well done, good sir.
The Divine St location is great.  The location, atmosphere, food, and service are all awesome.  Go out there, grab a beer and a burger and enjoy yourself.
The food is consistently fresh and delightful, cashiers hands over fantastic customer service. I loved how neat it is and vibes. I highly recommend this place.

name: Harambe Ethiopian Restaurant
reviews:
Calm and quiet, I loved the ambience of this eatery. Their spread is decent and reasonably priced. The flavors (read heat) although are kept milder to suit the taste buds of the locals.
Our waitress was very nice and welcoming and did a very good job helping us decide the lunch course.

We enjoyed a wonderful (takeout) meal from Harambe. I had been meaning to try the restaurant since moving to Columbia and I am so glad I did. The vegetable sampler and Harambe sampler are both fantastic. I can’t wait to order again and to eat in soon!

The staff was friendly and the service was fairly fast. We got the veggie samosas as an appetizer and just wow! Those bite size samosas and fill with lots of flavor. As our main entree we had the Harambe Combo. It was very delicious! I cannot wait to go back, this place is a gem.

My husband and I went at a quiet time, around 2. We were welcomed and given menus. Everything on their menu sounds good but I decided to try the chicken tibs and beef tibs. My husband had the meat platter. The flavors were amazing!!!! Lovely and cozy atmosphere. There is a bar and it looks like they may have a lively happy hour but we were able to enjoy our food and quiet.
It was the first time i go to an Ethiopian  restaurant,  and I personally loved this place. The food was delicious, and a great experience  with the family.  Definitely recommend this place.

name: Yesterdays Restaurant & Tavern
reviews: Fantastic experience with this place during restaurant week! I got the rib plate (should say riblets as it advertises itself as a full rack of ribs when it's a half rack (?)) with mashed potatoes and gravy as well as mac and cheese. Ribs were tasty and the moonshine sauce was really good, though I wish it had more "moonshine" flavor and was a little less sweet. Mac and cheese was the standout. Unique and savory, with some bell pepper to give it a twist. Mashed potatoes were maybe a little on the heavy side, but flavor was fabulous. Friend got the London broil with the horseradish sauce (which was perfect) and the flank steak was spot on. Very good experience. I'll be returning.

Went for brunch on a Saturday. No wait. Pleasant customer service. Pictured is the fish and grits, hash brown casserole and chicken and waffles. The fish was well seasoned. The grits were just OK. I'm a southern girl who knows grits. The chicken and waffles were average per the hubby. I didn't taste the hash browns. The fish and grits were quite filling!

Ordered takeout through Bitesquad - ordered chili cheese fries and was given fries with cheese on top. No chili, no black beans. Ordered a taco salad and was given the most pitiful pile of iceberg lettuce with avocado and mushy chicken on top. I was so excited to be having a good meal and was left highly disappointed. In a time where takeout is KEY, take more pride in what you’re doing.

We have been going here since they opened  40 years ago. It's also a favorite if we have out of town family or friends visiting as the menu has something for everyone. My husband loves the Confederate fried steak with gravy while I usually go with shrimp tacos or a vegetable plate. The hot fudge sundae is to die for and easily feeds two. Here's to another 40 years!!!!! PS: And their  servers ROCK!

Been a long time since I've come down to five points to get some of that old cowboy, fully dressed in a tub. Great food, big selection of beer on tap and I've always had good service. College kids can be amusing.

name: Hendrix Restaurant
reviews: Want to get some delicious food and cocktails.  Had the pleasure to eat here and had the catch of the day.  The Swordfish was purely magical with The Huntsman to follow.  A juicy perfectly cooked blackened Swordfish.  The Huntsman crafted by Boone was a beautifully concocted bourbon cocktail with a smokey campfire salted rim.  I feel I could eat here every night!

Did not really know what to expect when walking in, but as soon as you get to the top of the stairwell you get a vibe of elegance and fine dining. Was a bit shocked at the menu prices, however everything prepared is locally sourced and was downright delicious! Is it a good place to go with your buddies to grab a cheap meal? No, but one shouldn't come to expect that of this restaurant. I went here for date night and it was a spectacular evening. The service was some of the best in Columbia, and the food not only was plated beautifully, but tasted wonderful as well.

Outstanding service from Alyssa! (Hope I spelled that right) she was beyond helpful and constantly smiling. Highly recommend the winter vegetable salad (top photo), fried oysters, pork tacos, crispy fried Brussels spirit leaves (and I hate Brussels sprouts). Classy yet trendy ambience. Didn’t get to check out the rooftop bar because of timing in my end, but definitely will be next time.

Hendrix is such a great place.  It's very cozy and very nicely set up.  The menu is delicious and so are the cocktails. My date and I stuck with the tapas menu and got the gnocchi, carnitas tacos, pork belly,  and the flash fried oysters.  All dishes were very tasty.  The shining star were the gnocchi.  OMG they were so good!  Definitely get 'em. The rooftop is also very cool.

Love the food, atmosphere and service! It is a great place for date night and love the character of the location! We will be back to enjoy! The flash fried brussel sprouts are incredible and I do not like  Brussels but could eat these all night!

name: Boeshreen
reviews:
My family and I felt hungry when we go back to Florida from North Carolina. I searched some halal food than I saw this restaurant. 
It was perfect than I thought. Cheese burger and gyro was delicious 😋 it was pretty quick. The workers were so polite. The manager was friendly, good cook at the same time. Turkish coffee was amazing 
Every one should be stop by this Libya restaurant on their trip.
