Great food with fast and friendly service! I ordered takeout for the first time and had such a good experience. They have an expansive menu with lots of dessert choices. The food was fantastic--I would recommend the lamb gyro (probably the best gyro I've ever had) and walnut baklava. I will be back soon!
The food here was spectacular and the service was great. The only downside was the baklava was old. Next time I'm in the area I will definitely go back.
Super nice staff, great food. Very reasonable prices. Would def go again.

The food is nothing special. The restaurant is kind of dirty. The food display was dirty with finger prints. The glass food display also had empty trays. The service was slow. I was expecting more from the good reviews. We came 15 minutes after it opened so it was disappointing. The bathroom wasn’t clean either. It was nasty.

name: Kao Thai Cuisine
reviews: I purchased the NYE 3 course meal with open bar package and it was a fantastic deal. The food was excellent (especially the soup appetizer and strawberry shortcake dessert), and so were the drinks. I was expecting cheap drinks for the NYE deal, but it was for the classic cocktails on their regular menu. I was very impressed with the service and all around experience. Highly recommend.
Excellent Thai food in Cola. The menu offers traditional Thai dishes that are executed better than most asian diners. The atmosphere is fun and lively. Service is great too!

I really liked this place! It wasn't crowded at all when we went, and as a really cool bonus, there's free parking (almost unheard of in the Vista). I tried both of their soups, which were excellent, and my friends got the drunken noodles (also good). The gyoza was perfection. Prices are a little on the high side for a lunch, but nothing unreasonable. I'd go again!

Great food, great atmosphere and good prices. Food is tasty, great blend of flavors and ingredients are fresh. Menu selection is decent and not overwhelming. From starters to entrees there is something for everyone.

The atmosphere and setup is interesting and very well lit. Service is attentive and very friendly!
I ordered pick up because of the lockdown and they were quick and courteous, labeled my boxes and brought it right out to my car. Very sweet and the Thai rice is good!!! 🌈

name: Zoës Kitchen
reviews:
First time I've ever eaten here and absolutely not my last. Where has this place been?! I loved their food! You can taste all the ingredients. Fresh vegetables, meats, and superbly well blended. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our party ranger from 12 to 46 and we all loved. The tomato bisque with the cheese topping was perfect!
Everything we had was tasty, filling but not heavy, and good for you. Nothing fried. 
Know for a fact I'll be back and this place has earned a new customer for life. Glad I joined their rewards program because I believe I'll utilize this. 
GREAT FOOD!

These guys help me get from class to work on time and in a healthy, affordable fashion! Always a pleasure over the phone and also quick and delicious. Well done guys! Thank you for your great service!

First time coming and had no real idea of what to expect.  Turns it it’s pretty decent Mediterranean food. Ordered the Mediterranean chicken mean with roasted veggie and pasta salad. Along with the chicken I put a little  of the spicy dressing on it. Turns out the chicken was really good without the dressing but was even better with. 

Only down side was the lack of some sort of bread. Since this was over $10 for it, that would have made it perfect.  I know the Mediterranean area is full of bread items, throw them in!

Still can highly recommend everything!
The food is delicious and the rice was soooooo amazing!! Definitely eating at this establishment again!
Food was ok but not what I was expecting from a Greek like place to eat. It was clean and quiet atmosphere. More like a fast food place to eat

name: Green Olive Restaurant
reviews: I really enjoyed my visit to this restaurant. The food was good, service was excellent, (glass was full, checked on me, and ensured food was good) and the servers were nice. The restaurant was clean and well lite. I found the prices as average for this type of establishment. I enjoyed my food. The pita bread came out hot which was a first for me. Usually it is cut up in most places but you get the whole bread here. It is located behind the capital buildings. I look forward to going back.

Great spot for Mediterranean food. This was my 2nd visit here.  Wait staff this time around wasnt as good as the first time I came. I wanted a side of mayo for my fries and I had to remind her after 5-10 minutes that i was waiting for it. I also asked for extra chicken in my chicken wrap and didn't get it and I asked for an extra portion of gyros for my takeout gyros platter and didn't get that either. I wasn't charged for them, so I didn't lose out.  I will be back again though as this spot is close to work and the food is always tasty.

Delicious Mediterranean Food.
I had the Gyro-which came with rice and vegetables. Austin, our server was excellent. We split the Baklava and were not disappointed. All was very well done. Highly  recommend!

Love, love Green Olive. Gave it 4 instead of 5 stars due to sometimes it seems like they're short on staff. The food is delicious. I always come for the calamari and gyro with fries. Restaurant is neat and clean.

My family went here when the first place we tried wouldn't take a large party, but I'm glad it worked out that way!  The food was great, especially the fresh baked flat bread.  My kids loved the shrimp kabobs.  Our server was very friendly and personable.

name: Main Street Public House
reviews: Server was very attentive and helped with every request we had. Made recommendations on everything we got and the food was great. Always a brilliant place to eat and drink.
Great find!  Tremendous service and fantastic food.  Very creative menu.  Beautiful restaurant.   I went for dinner and then back for lunch.   Can't wait for my next trip back to Columbia!

Great place for food and drinks. Yummy food at fair prices. Excellent and knowledgeable staff. Wonderful beer menu and whiskey selection. Sparse cocktail menu, but quality ingredients. Dry rub wings are incredible if that’s your thing.

Good beer and food. Prices are OK. Service was very poor. Not a lot of people at the place yet it took forever for a few plates in our table. Some of us finished our food before others were served. Two people on my table received their plate and not their side. Received the side after finished they finished their food. Manager came and said sorry and that we were lucky it didn’t take longer. Unfortunately the good food was overshadowed by the poor kitchen service and manager.

Didn't have a reservation for New Year's. We were fitted in within 30 minutes. Disappointed they were out of truffle fries though it looked like people that came after us had them served. Good service.

name: LongHorn Steakhouse - Curbside To Go Available
address: 902 Gervais St Ste A, Columbia, SC 29201, USA
reviews:
Staff greeted as we came in and as we were leaving. 
Steak was cooked to perfection. Teddy, our server, was awesome. Manager came by to ask how everything was. It was my friends birthday so they gave him a big dish of ice cream with whipped cream... overall, it was wonderful. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this Longhorn Steakhouse.

LongHorn lived up to its reputation in Columbia. Good food, good service and great ambiance. It was not very crowded which supported a faster service as they were six in our group. We also observed an even bigger group that also received similar service from the staff. There was a mix up with one of our orders, but management stepped in and quickly fixed the problem.We will be coming back.

This is a very unique longhorn. It's in a very cool historical building. The service was excellent. They accidentally overcooked my son's steak, but took it back and had him a new one in no time. They had very good cocktails. I had the old fashioned and it was amazing. Just an over all very good experience. I would recommend anybody to try this location.

I ordered the Cesar salad with chicken, the lettuce didn't taste very fresh, bitter and the dressing was awful, too thick. The smokehouse chicken wings were amazing!!! I'd return to order those chicken wings 👍
Longhorn Steakhouse never disappoints.  One of the Best Steaks!  The Wild West Shrimp and the Strawberry Daiquiri are the Best Around!!

name: The Devine Cinnamon Roll Deli
reviews: This place is luscious! Reminds me of my grandmother's kitchen. The smell of sweet cinnamon rolls fills the air and you are hit with it immediately upon entering the space. Such a cute and quaint space for a nice breakfast. Had the shrimp and grit bowl which was quite filling and delicious for the price. Loved that they include a mini cinnamon roll with each purchase. Just enough to satisfy my sweet craving! Will definitely be back to try the maple and bacon cinnamon roll 😋

Great cinnamon roles bar none. What I was not expecting was how good their food was. I have a hot dog and it was pretty much the best I have ever had. Served on a brioche bun and the chips...wow. so very good. Get there early. They get crowded and close early. 

Everyone should go here if your passing even remotely close.

Going to Cinnamon roll deli is always a great experience. The sandwiches are delicious and the cinnamon rolls are out of this world. Although parking is limited and there is normally a line, it is worth it and the owner is always trying to make sure that you have a great experience. She brought out waters and chip s while we waited. The food came out fast and there was a lot of it. Definitely recommend to everyone. It’s the first place I mention whenever anyone asks for recommendations in Columbia

Everything is delicious. The food is absolutely worth the wait for  breakfast or lunch. And the owner is amazing, she make sure her customer are enjoying there food. I can’t wait to go back! The cinnamon rolls are not overly sweet they are the perfect Balance! They have something for everyone.

My husband had the Big D sandwich, which he said was absolutely delicious! He also had the Carolina Nachos, which weren't great. They were freshly baked chips topped with cold chili, shredded cheese and sour cream. Would be better warm. I ordered two cinnamon rolls, the Wild Berry & graham cracker was delicious. It was fairly dark and crunchy around the edges, but still good. I also got the Black Pepper Maple Bacon cinnamon roll. The menu says this one was featured on the Food Network, but I'm not sure why. The roll was good, but it was all sweet and no salty. I could barely taste the pepper and the bacon had no flavor whatsoever. I might return again to try a sandwich, but as others said, parking is awful and it's not worth waiting in line if you go on a weekend.

name: Camon Japanese Restaurant
reviews: It's really hard to go to any other restaurants in town because when I'm eating, I just think, "Man, I could be eating something at Camon right now." 10/10 best Japanese food around, especially the sushi and curry. The service is excellent, staff is friendly, and - I cannot emphasize this enough - the food is incredible. I've had sushi around the world, including several restaurants in Japan, and Camon's is still one of my top favorites!
Delicious sushi! Great sushi bar and people.

Best sushi and authentic Japanese food in the area. You'd be hard pressed to find better in Okinawa or Sapporo. I personally suggest the Eel and softshell crab rolls. It was amazing! Just be careful of "the sake" it will sneak up on you and bam!!
Best sushi place In Columbia hands down been coming for 20 years.  Always fresh and highest quality
The sushi here is pretty good except they need to go light on wasabi!

name: The Pot Smoker BBQ
reviews: First BBQ place we tried since moving to Columbia and we were not disappointed. Homemade sauces are great and I loved my Pulled Pork Plate!

Brisket sandwich was huge. Tasted great with the different sauces. Hash and rice was not what I was hoping for, would get something different next time. Pork was also tasty. Great service dining in, nice outdoor patio seating with water features. Great place but not much parking, as typical in most places downtown.

Amazing food the reason I actually came here is I was driving by and could smell the most amazing smell of bbq chicken! So delicious and so well prepared 5 out of 5 stars hands down! Will be returning!

Just walking by The Pot Smoker will make you hungry. The delicious smokey aroma draws you in. We ordered the redneck nachos and bbq plates. Let me tell you...I am not a huge fan of pork rinds but their nachos use them in place of chips and are piled high with tons of smoked pulled pork, cheese, and bacon. These things can be a meal on their own. Prices are fair, staff is friendly and informative, and the food is excellent. This is definitely a must stop in if you're in Downtown Columbia and love BBQ.
Bit into the Brisket sandwich and yelled "Shut your face!" The sandwich was amazing. You should eat one! Great prices and really good food.  Thanks for a memorable meal.

name: Golden Bay Seafood Restaurant
address: 6164 St Andrews Rd, Columbia, SC 29212, USA
reviews: Very clean and organized restaurant.  Service was quick and server was friendly and courteous.  Food came out quickly and was hot and delicious.  The flounder was mouth watering good. They have a nice menu with plenty to choose from. And the prices are very reasonable. The restaurant is decorated nicely throughout.  Great job folk's!

Great little seafood establishment. Obviously not well known or else it would be more crowded. Great seafood and wonderful service. Prices are VERY reasonable.  Have been here several times and the food is ALWAYS good. The atmosphere is casual, food is always good and service on point. Will definitely be back!

I am a seafood lover and I came across this restaurant on Facebook so I thought I'll go and check it out..OMG I don't know where to start, because everything was excellent. I ordered  the Captain Platter and it was soo fresh ,hot, delicious and the price was amazingly cheap. I once was a fan of Red Lobster not anymore Golden Bay is my New seafood spot. If you don't believe me go check it out for yourself. You will truly change your mind about going to any other seafood restaurant. I give this place 10 ⭐ and 10 thumbs up👍❤

The food is incredible. It does not take very long to get your order. And the owners and staff are extremely nice. They make you feel like a part of their family.We visit here about three or four times a month and have yet to be disappointed.

Eating fried sea food; you don't know what to expect... will it all be breading, is there flavor? THIS PLACE IS EXCELLENT!! Light on the breading and packed with great flavor! I followed the waiter's suggestion for adding tossed cracked pepper and salt; it was not overwhelming, but a nice kick to the food. I was too full for dessert, but I will be back... maybe next time. The waiter was very attentive. Thank you for a great dinner.

name: The Mouse Trap Columbia, SC
reviews: I believe we stopped in Monday, May 6, 2019. I have eaten here twice before it was remodeled/redone. Both of those time were fresh and delicious. This visit was delicious as well. They had trivia night going and sounded like fun, although we did not participate. We started off with the Oysters Rockafellas. This appetizer is packed with so much flavor they will blow you away! My boyfriend had the Honey Mustard Chicken Salad and I had the Charleston Chicken as entrees. Both entrees were equally delicious along with the sides. Definitely an off the path place to check out.

The cocktails were fantastic, and the service was amazing.  I think at one point we spoke to almost every staff member & they were all very sweet. However, I do feel like the food was a bit expensive for the quality.  Don’t get me wrong, it wasn’t horrible, the portions were adequate, but it wasn’t anything to swoon over, either.  Certain aspects of the meal almost seemed like they were frozen & then heated, rather than cooked fresh.  We generally enjoyed our evening, but I think if we returned it would be for the bar more so than the food.
The crab cakes are excellent!  Fish Fry-Day features fried flounder, shrimp, hush puppies, and french fries and generally sells out, so order early.

We tried the salmon wrap and a burger which was thick and juicy. Both were delicious and the service was good. I will eat here again. Recommend using GPS for location because it's at the back of the building.

Excellent veggie burger! The fries are amazing. Family friendly atmosphere and neat history to the restaurant. Check out the cool bar made from old wooden doors. Mouse Trap is a hidden treasure and has a great menu.

name: Bourbon
reviews: Amazing food, great service!
Brunch was amazing. Best place to eat on sunday morning

If you're looking for a happy hour special, Bourbon is hard to beat. 4-6 pm, $10 will get you a $4 beer, a shot of Bulleit bourbon, and a burger (no sides). If you want a beer that isn't $4 they charge the difference. And Bourbon burgers are solid. Delicious beef ground in house and cooked to order. Served on warm delicious butter glazed buns with onion, tomato, and Boston bib lettuce, with condiments on the side. Your choice of cheese. The beef is perfectly seasoned so that you can really enjoy the flavor of the beef without it being overwhelmed by a lot of excess toppings.

This place is amazing. It's my second time here and my food was beyond expectations both times. This time I ordered the lamb burger and egg rolls. The bartender was great and helpful. Will be back soon.

Neat little place! 
I've been wanting to try it for some time. I finally made it there for brunch. (Mimosas are very good and inexpensive)

I hope to get back soon for dinner and cocktails. They have a great selection of liquors from common to rare.

I definitely recommend Bourbon.

name: The Villa
address: 1704 Bush River Rd, Columbia, SC 29210, USA
reviews:
This Villa Special large pizza was enough for  
three. It was delicious and beautiful, look at it. Better yet, go eat some. We've been visiting this Bush River Road Italian spot since it was built, oh maybe, forty years.Yes, I know, we can hardly believe it either. When there was another "the Villa" in Five Points, they also were known for great flavor.They still have that special touch. We celebrated my wife's birthday here. Yum!

The atmosphere and staff are great, but the food is not! The pizza crust reminds me of something you can get at a gas station, though the toppings were good. When I mentioned it to the staff, I was told that their regulars would revolt if they were to change the crust! Well I say that you should get a new set of regulars, because they have no taste in pizza! Go for the atmosphere, go for the wine, but don't go for the food or you will be disappointed!
Fast service on my lunch hour and reasonable prices for my purse.  Plus all the menu options I've tried so far have been delicious!  Plenty of options for dieters, too.
I 🧡💜 The Villa!  Beef & onion pizza and salad with meat & cheese with sweet tea....that is what was for lunch!

Would make a great place for a date due to ambiance. However, their pizza was not great. I was surprised to learn that they didn’t have fresh garlic as a pizza topping given that it’s an Italian restaurant. Pizza did not have enough cheese and was heavy on the pizza/tomato sauce. Sauce tasted like it was straight out of a can. I can’t comment on their other items but was disappointed with their pizza.

name: City Limits Barbeque (food truck)
reviews: Ate here today for the first time, it was at WECO. Believe the hype this truck is the best. The brisket is so good, I’m really looking forward to being able to try the beef ribs when they have them.
Great people, awesome food. Absolutely worth any sort of wait. (Usually there will be good beer nearby)

Oh boy...where to start...I was hunting down beef ribs standing in the cold for 30minutes  to get them only to be disappointed when the person in front got the last of the ribs...but it forced me to try the Brisket and Pork belly bites...omg soo good. Can't wait to get the ribs. There is a fine line of wanting someone to be noticed and successful but not so much that it makes it impossible to get your favorites for yourself....lol
Gouda mac n cheese was great also.

Robbie catered an event for me this month and it was simply AMAZING!!  My friends who are huge BBQ fans all said it was the best brisket, pulled pork and chicken they had ever had!  The service was tremendous, Robbie was so easy to work with.

This is the best BBQ in town. City Limits combines top-quality meats with flawless execution on the smoker to deliver a fantastic product. The beef ribs are the only ones of their kind in the Midlands. They combine tender beef, a smoky finish and a peppery bark for a taste of Texas Q in South Carolina.

name: Michael's Café & Catering
reviews: Our daughter was married 2/25/17. We booked the facility connected to Michael's Café called Agape Conference Center - Hampton Room. Michael's provided the catering for both the rehearsal dinner and reception. Everything was wonderful! A small group of us even returned on Sunday morning for their brunch. Highly recommend this venue for any type of event or business meeting when combining with their catering. Allison our event planner was great to work with and had her own check list to help us as we planned.
Stopped in for a quick lunch downtown and loved the atmosphere. The food was delicious and service was great. I will definitely be returning.

Used to love this place but it has really gone downhill ever since it changed to "the venue on main/main course/top golf/Michael's".  Service is just terrible now so just be aware of.what you're potentially getting yourself in to if you decide to go.  Having said all that, the food is consistent.

This brunch experience was amazing. We walked in and were seated immediately. The staff was very friendly and the drinks were amazing. The food was incredible. This is definitely a spot where I will be visiting once a week.
The menu is top-notch, if a little pricey, and the staff are extremely friendly and personable.  Just be careful not to get lost in its layout.

name: Cellar On Greene
address: 2001 Greene St D, Columbia, SC 29205, USA
reviews:
Small, quaint, and intimate. I have been looking for a decent wine spot in this city and I am happy to learn that I have found one! WINE LOVER FRIENDLY. Not a huge selection of foods on the menu but the available options are tasty. Snacks and desserts are offered but the main focus feels like it’s on the wine. The bartender definitely knows her stuff and was able to accurately recommend two different wines based off my palate and preference.

I got a Skillet Seared Cab Flat Iron Steak (medium) and the Dark Chocolate-Caramel Soufflé. The entry and dessert were more delicious than they look… if this is even possible.

Great service in a cozy setting. I've never had a bad meal here and it's a wonderful place for a date night. Of course, don't forget about the wine. The knowledgeable staff will help you find a great pairing to any dish. It can sometimes be a wait to get a table but it's worth it.

This is some of the best food in Columbia and just like the name suggests has one of those most varied wine Selections in Columbia. The reservation is probably recommended especially for Friday and Saturday. The dishes are amazing and the chef is amazing with everything I've ever eaten here cooked and plated to perfection

Casual non pretentious atmosphere. They have an excellent, rotating wine selection. The food is consistently good and the menu changes werkly. The servers can help pair wine with food. Want to taste a new wine? Just ask!

Wonderful evening and the 3 for $29 is a great value. Excellent wine list, creative and well executed food items, and a friendly and educated staff make for a great date spot.  Thanks to Jessica, Joanna and the rest of Cellar's staff for a delicious date night for our anniversary.
